programme.title: Arthur & Merlin
programme.desc: An evil druid wreaks havoc on ancient Britain, determined to wipe out the Celtic people. A young warrior who has been driven into exile joins forces with a hermit wizard to stop his reign of terror and save their people from annihilation. Fantasy adventure, starring Kirk Barker and Stefan Butler(n).(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent is assigned to infiltrate a gang of daredevil extreme sports athletes, and prove that they are responsible for a string of audacious bank robberies. As he pushes himself to the limit to prove his worth to the group, he forms an intense relationship with their enigmatic leader. Action thriller remake, starring Edgar Ramirez, Luke Bracey and Ray Winstone(n).(n)

programme.title: God's Pocket
programme.desc: A construction worker believes his life will be simpler following the death of his troublemaking stepson. However, he finds things go from bad to worse as his relationship with his wife deteriorates and a reporter grows suspicious about the tragedy. Drama based on Peter Dexter's novel, starring Philip Seymour Hoffman, Christina Hendricks and John Turturro(n).(n)

programme.title: Moana: Special
programme.desc: A look at the animated Disney adventure featuring the voices of Dwayne Johnson and Jemaine Clement(n).(n)

programme.title: Couple in a Hole
programme.desc: A couple choose to live in a cave in the woods, surviving by hunting rabbits and feeding on insects. When the wife is bitten by a poisonous spider, they are forced to reconnect with the outside world and turn to a farmer for help, who takes a suspicious interest in their reasons for renouncing civilisation. Drama, starring Paul Higgins and Kate Dickie(n).(n)

programme.title: Secret in Their Eyes
programme.desc: A tight-knit FBI team is torn apart when the daughter of one of the agents is raped and murdered, and the case goes unsolved. Years later, a member of the team uncovers a new clue that he hopes will allow him to bring the killer to justice. However, the victim's grieving mother is dissatisfied with the law and takes matters into her own hands. Crime drama, starring Julia Roberts, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Nicole Kidman(n).(n)

programme.title: True Deception
programme.desc: An author struggling with writer's block and drug addiction becomes fascinated with a high-profile murder trial, especially when a friend of the defendant confesses to murders he probably did not commit. He is determined to find out why he would do such a thing, finding parallels with his own father. Drama based on Stephen Elliot's novel The Adderall Diaries, starring James Franco, Ed Harris, Amber Heard and Christian Slater(n).(n)

programme.title: The Pack
programme.desc: A farmer's plans for the future are ruined when a pack of wild dogs attacks and kills all his livestock. However, worse is still to come - the ravenous predators are still hungry and turn their attention to human prey, leaving the farmer and his family facing a battle for survival. Horror, starring Anna Lise Phillips and Jack Campbell(n).(n)

programme.desc: A closeted gay man in his 60s is trapped in a loveless marriage to a woman who is unaware of his sexuality. Drama, starring Robin Williams and Kathy Baker(n).(n)

programme.title: Carnage Park
programme.desc: Premiere. Two criminals take a woman hostage and flee into the backwoods following a disastrous bank robbery. What should have been a safe haven proves a far greater threat than the cops on their trail when they stray into the territory of a former military sniper driven by his experiences of war and who does not take kindly to strangers on his land. Horror, starring Ashley Bell and Pat Healy(n).(n)

programme.title: Secret in Their Eyes
programme.desc: A tight-knit FBI team is torn apart when the daughter of one of the agents is raped and murdered, and the case goes unsolved. Years later, a member of the team uncovers a new clue that he hopes will allow him to bring the killer to justice. However, the victim's grieving mother is dissatisfied with the law and takes matters into her own hands. Crime drama, starring Julia Roberts, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Nicole Kidman(n).(n)

programme.title: Seventh Son
programme.desc: An ageing professional monster hunter hires a young apprentice and sets about teaching him the tricks of his trade - and the duo will need to use them all if they are to recapture the evil queen of the witches after she escapes from the pit in which she was incarcerated. Fantasy adventure, starring Ben Barnes, Jeff Bridges and Julianne Moore(n).(n)

programme.title: Animal Kingdom: Let's Go Ape
programme.desc: Animated adventure about a primate king's outcast son who eventually comes into his own, learning how to run on two legs and the secrets of fire. Featuring the voices of Jamel Debbouze, Melissa Theuriau and Arie Elmaleh(n).(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show 2016
programme.desc: Countdown of the biggest box office hits in Britain and America(n).(n)

programme.title: Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian
programme.desc: The living exhibits at New York's Museum of Natural History are shipped to Washington's Smithsonian Institution - along with the artefact that brought them to life in the first place. Nightwatchman Larry tries to retrieve it, only to find the contents of the world's largest museum have been reanimated, including a pharaoh determined to take over the world. Fantasy comedy sequel, starring Ben Stiller, Amy Adams, Owen Wilson and Steve Coogan(n).(n)

programme.title: Avengers: Age of Ultron
programme.desc: The superhero team faces a threat from within when Iron Man creates an artificial intelligence to take their place protecting the world. The android grows resentful of his creators, and decides his mission is best accomplished by wiping out the human race. Meanwhile, two vengeful superpowered twins seek to turn the Avengers against each other. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Robert Downey Jr, Chris Hemsworth, Chris Evans and Scarlett Johansson(n).(n)

programme.title: Seventh Son
programme.desc: An ageing professional monster hunter hires a young apprentice and sets about teaching him the tricks of his trade - and the duo will need to use them all if they are to recapture the evil queen of the witches after she escapes from the pit in which she was incarcerated. Fantasy adventure, starring Ben Barnes, Jeff Bridges and Julianne Moore(n).(n)

programme.title: The Theory of Everything
programme.desc: Biopic of Stephen Hawking, exploring the renowned astrophysicist's romance with future wife Jane during their time at university in the 1960s and his initial diagnosis with motor neurone disease, which doctors believed would lead to his death within two years. Undaunted by deteriorating health, he continued his groundbreaking research into the origins of the universe. Starring an Oscar-winning Eddie Redmayne, with Felicity Jones and David Thewlis(n).(n)

programme.title: The Theory of Everything

Undaunted by deteriorating health, he continued his groundbreaking research into the origins of the universe. Starring an Oscar-winning Eddie Redmayne, with Felicity Jones and David Thewlis(n).(n)

programme.title: The Interview
programme.desc: The presenter of a lowbrow TV show and his producer plan a trip to North Korea after landing an exclusive interview with dictator Kim Jong-un. Before setting off, they are recruited by the CIA to assassinate the politician - a task they are sorely underqualified to carry out. Controversial comedy, starring James Franco, Seth Rogen and Lizzy Caplan(n).(n)

programme.title: Kill the Messenger
programme.desc: A journalist is driven to the brink of suicide by a smear campaign after he attempts to expose the CIA's alleged involvement with Contra rebels in Nicaragua and the importing of cocaine into California. Fact-based drama set during the 1990s, starring Jeremy Renner, Rosemarie DeWitt and Ray Liotta(n).(n)

programme.title: Animal Kingdom: Let's Go Ape
programme.desc: Animated adventure about a primate king's outcast son who eventually comes into his own, learning how to run on two legs and the secrets of fire. Featuring the voices of Jamel Debbouze, Melissa Theuriau and Arie Elmaleh(n).(n)

programme.title: Big Eyes
programme.desc: Aspiring painter Margaret Keane marries a controlling man who sells her artwork. As the paintings of large-eyed children grow tremendously popular, Margaret discovers he is claiming to have painted them himself, and she and her daughter are forced to live a lie for years - until she finally resolves to prove his deceit in court. Tim Burton's fact-based drama, starring Amy Adams, Christoph Waltz and Terence Stamp(n).(n)

programme.title: Woman in Gold
programme.desc: An elderly Austrian woman who fled the country during the Second World War returns to her home country in search of justice. Several art treasures belonging to her family were seized by the Nazis when she escaped, including a famous painting by Klimt, and she enlists the aid of an American lawyer in reclaiming them from the current government. Fact-based drama, starring Helen Mirren, Ryan Reynolds and Daniel Bruhl(n).(n)

programme.title: Night at the Museum: Secret of the Tomb
programme.desc: Nightwatchman Larry notices that the living exhibits of his museum are behaving strangely. He discovers that the magical artefact that brings them to life is damaged, so he and his friends travel to London's Natural History Museum to find a way to restore it. Fantasy comedy sequel, starring Ben Stiller, Rebel Wilson and Robin Williams in his final film role(n).(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show 2016
programme.desc: Countdown of the biggest box office hits in Britain and America(n).(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: A whaling ship sets sail from New England in 1820, only to come under attack from a gigantic whale that seems to want revenge on them. In the aftermath of the attack, the surviving members of the crew face further physical and moral challenges as they try to stay alive on the open sea. Fact-based historical adventure, starring Chris Hemsworth, Cillian Murphy and Ben Whishaw(n).(n)

programme.title: John Wick
programme.desc: The dying wife of a retired assassin leaves him a puppy, in the hope that having something to love will stop him returning to a life of violence when she is gone. When the son of a Russian gangster steals his car and kills the dog, the hitman is provoked into a murderous rage and slaughters his way through the underworld in search of revenge. Action thriller, starring Keanu Reeves and Willem Dafoe(n).(n)

programme.title: Selma
programme.desc: In 1965, amidst an atmosphere of racial unrest, civil rights campaigner Dr Martin Luther King Jr plans a peaceful march across Alabama from Selma to Montgomery. His goal is to persuade President Lyndon B Johnson to change the law, allowing black people to register to vote. Fact-based drama, starring David Oyelowo, Tom Wilkinson and Carmen Ejogo(n).(n)

programme.title: Night at the Museum: Secret of the Tomb
programme.desc: Nightwatchman Larry notices that the living exhibits of his museum are behaving strangely. Fantasy comedy sequel, starring Ben Stiller, Rebel Wilson and Robin Williams in his final film role(n).(n)

programme.title: Horrible Bosses 2
programme.desc: Three friends decide to start their own business, but the plan is derailed when a duplicitous investor swindles them. They hatch a plan to get their money back by kidnapping the businessman's son and demanding a ransom. Comedy, starring Jason Bateman, Jason Sudeikis, Charlie Day, Jennifer Aniston and Christoph Waltz(n).(n)

programme.title: Woman in Gold
programme.desc: An elderly Austrian woman who fled the country during the Second World War returns to her home country in search of justice. programme.title: Pitch Perfect 2 Special
programme.desc: Anna Kendrick, Rebel Wilson and Elizabeth Banks discuss reprising their roles for the comedy sequel(n).(n)

programme.title: Friday Download: The Movie
programme.desc: A group of teenagers on a road trip breaks down in the middle of nowhere, and finds assistance is in short supply. The friends seek shelter in a spooky mansion, but they quickly discover there is more to their refuge than meets the eye. Comedy based on the children's TV series, starring Tyger Drew-Honey and Shannon Flynn(n).(n)

programme.title: A Warrior's Tail
programme.desc: A boy escapes when his village comes under attack by a pack of hyenas, and goes to get help. He meets a magical white wolf, who leads him on a journey in search of a magician who can help them find a powerful warrior - but many danger's lie between them and the sorcerer's mountain home. Animated fantasy, with the voices of Milla Jovovich, Whoopi Goldberg and Sharon Stone(n).(n)

programme.title: The Interview
programme.desc: The presenter of a lowbrow TV show and his producer plan a trip to North Korea after landing an exclusive interview with dictator Kim Jong-un. Before setting off, they are recruited by the CIA to assassinate the politician - a task they are sorely underqualified to carry out. Controversial comedy, starring James Franco, Seth Rogen and Lizzy Caplan(n).(n)

programme.title: Black Sea
programme.desc: A submarine captain working for a salvage company is laid off, and attempts to turn his fortunes around by recovering a lost treasure rumoured to have sunk to the depths of the Black Sea. However, greed, desperation and claustrophobia cause the members of his crew to turn against each other. Thriller, starring Jude Law and Jodie Whittaker(n).(n)

programme.title: Exodus: Gods and Kings
programme.desc: Moses, the adoptive brother of the pharaoh of Egypt, is sent into exile, where he receives a message from God demanding he set all the country's slaves free. When his brother refuses to comply, the kingdom is struck by a series of devastating plagues. Biblical epic, starring Christian Bale, Joel Edgerton, Sigourney Weaver and John Turturro(n).(n)

programme.title: Taken 3 - Extended Cut
programme.desc: Ex-CIA agent Bryan Mills' efforts to finally live a quiet life are shattered by the death of his ex-wife. Just when things seemingly can't get any worse, he is framed for her murder and must fight to clear his name. Action thriller sequel, starring Liam Neeson, Forest Whitaker and Maggie Grace(n).(n)

programme.title: Burnt
programme.desc: An inventive chef's unconventional methods make him the toast of Paris, but his career is derailed by an alcohol and drugs-fuelled meltdown. An old friend offers him a second chance by hiring him to take over the kitchens of an exclusive London restaurant, but has a hard time keeping his acerbic nature in check. Drama, starring Bradley Cooper, Sienna Miller, Daniel Bruhl, Emma Thompson and Uma Thurman(n).(n)

programme.title: Steve Jobs
programme.desc: Danny Boyle's biopic of the technology entrepreneur, exploring his life through three pivotal moments over the course of 14 years. Jobs is passionately driven to revolutionise computing technology, but his dreams come at a price, with a devastating impact on both is relationship with his family and his own health. Starring Michael Fassbender, Kate Winslet and Seth Rogen(n).(n)

programme.title: Taken 3 - Extended Cut
programme.desc: Ex-CIA agent Bryan Mills' efforts to finally live a quiet life are shattered by the death of his ex-wife. Just when things seemingly can't get any worse, he is framed for her murder and must fight to clear his name. Action thriller sequel, starring Liam Neeson, Forest Whitaker and Maggie Grace(n).(n)

programme.title: Exodus: Gods and Kings
programme.desc: Moses, the adoptive brother of the pharaoh of Egypt, is sent into exile, where he receives a message from God demanding he set all the country's slaves free. When his brother refuses to comply, the kingdom is struck by a series of devastating plagues. Biblical epic, starring Christian Bale, Joel Edgerton, Sigourney Weaver and John Turturro(n).(n)

programme.title: The Pink Panther
programme.desc: The world's most inept police detective, Inspector Clouseau, heads off to Switzerland in search of a suave jewel thief who has purloined a priceless diamond from a princess - but the bumbling officer's every ruse to foil the crime ends in chaos, not least when he is framed for the robbery himself. Blake Edwards' comedy, starring Peter Sellers, David Niven, Capucine, Robert Wagner and Claudia Cardinale(n).(n)

programme.title: Spud 2: The Madness Continues
programme.desc: A teenager's trials and tribulations continue as he tries to negotiate his second year at boarding school. Comedy-drama, starring Troye Sivan, John Cleese and Sven Ruygrok(n).(n)

programme.title: Christmas with the Kranks
programme.desc: A married couple from Chicago decide to steer clear of the usual festive celebrations and keep their cash for a holiday in the sun, prompting a busybody neighbour to call on the local community to pull out all the stops to make them change their minds. Festive comedy based on a novel by John Grisham, starring Jamie Lee Curtis, Tim Allen, Dan Aykroyd and M Emmet Walsh(n).(n)

programme.title: Magic Mike XXL
programme.desc: A male stripper who retired from the stage three years ago is persuaded to put on one last show. A troupe of dancers are also planning to call it a day and recruit him to headline their final show. The guys head off on a road trip to the venue, making some new friends and picking up a few new moves along the way. Drama sequel, starring Channing Tatum and Joe Manganiello(n).(n)

programme.title: Nacho Libre
programme.desc: A portly Mexican friar working as a cook in an orphanage adopts the guise of a masked wrestler. He teams up with a thief and enters a tournament hoping to win enough money to sort out the monastery's financial problems, feed the kids under his care and impress the nun he is in love with. Comedy, starring Jack Black and Ana de la Reguera(n).(n)

programme.title: Daddy's Home
programme.desc: A mild-mannered man hopes for his wife's two children to view him as their father. His dreams of perfect family life are threatened by the return of their biological father, a charismatic, motorcycle-riding tough guy, and he pulls out all the stops to prove to his stepchildren that he can be just as cool. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell and Mark Wahlberg(n).(n)

programme.title: Hitch
programme.desc: A professional relationship guru, who specialises in offering advice to lonely single men, helps an unlucky-in-love accountant to woo the girl of his dreams. However, when he finds himself falling for a beautiful gossip columnist, his usual charm abandons him and he discovers his expertise counts for nothing. Romantic comedy, with Will Smith, Eva Mendes, Kevin James, Amber Valletta, Julie Ann Emery, Adam Arkin and Michael Rapaport(n).(n)

programme.title: Year One
programme.desc: An inept hunter and his shy gatherer sidekick are kicked out of their tribe and left to wander the Old Testament world. Blundering through several key moments of the Bible, they eventually end up at Sodom, where they must try and rescue their people from slavery. Comedy, starring Jack Black, Michael Cera, Oliver Platt and Hank Azaria(n).(n)

programme.title: Daddy's Home
programme.desc: A mild-mannered man hopes for his wife's two children to view him as their father. His dreams of perfect family life are threatened by the return of their biological father, a charismatic, motorcycle-riding tough guy, and he pulls out all the stops to prove to his stepchildren that he can be just as cool. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell and Mark Wahlberg(n).(n)

programme.title: The Night Before
programme.desc: Childhood friends Ethan, Isaac and Chris have always spent Christmas Eve enjoying a night of drink and debauchery. As they finally come to accept adult responsibility, they decide to bring this tradition to an end by attending an exclusive party - but finding their way there proves an adventure in itself. Comedy, starring Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Seth Rogen and Anthony Mackie(n).(n)

programme.title: Bad Bromance
programme.desc: Dan Landsman prepares to attend a high-school reunion, and hopes to make a good impression on people who never had any time for him in his teens. To that end, he tracks down a famous classmate to persuade him to attend - but is unprepared for the consequences of letting the celebrity into his life. Comedy, starring Jack Black and James Marsden(n).(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show 2016
programme.desc: Countdown of the biggest box office hits in Britain and America(n).(n)

programme.title: Search Party
programme.desc: Distraught over the realization that they scared away their best friend's fiancee, two hard-partying pals set out on a wild journey to reunite the estranged couple by any means necessary. Comedy, starring Adam Pally, TJ Miller and Thomas Middleditch(n).(n)

programme.title: Who's Harry Crumb
programme.desc: A bungling private eye sets out to rescue the abducted daughter of a millionaire. Unfortunately, the hapless sleuth is unaware his oily boss is behind the kidnapping and has only given him the task because he is sure to fail - while leaving himself free to make a move on the millionaire's wife. Comedy, starring John Candy, Jeffrey Jones, Annie Potts and Tim Thomerson(n).(n)

programme.title: A Shot in the Dark
programme.desc: The bungling Inspector Clouseau is sent to investigate a high-profile murder case. All the clues point to a maid being the guilty party, but the accident-prone detective is instantly smitten with her, and devotes his efforts to proving her innocence - despite all evidence to the contrary. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers, Elke Sommer, George Sanders and Herbert Lom(n).(n)

programme.title: Spud 3: Learning to Fly
programme.desc: Comedy drama charting the trials and tribulations of an awkward teenager entering his third year at boarding school. Starring Troye Sivan and John Cleese(n).(n)

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada
programme.desc: A woman with dreams of becoming a journalist takes a job as assistant to the editor of a prestigious fashion magazine - a position that should guarantee a bright future if she succeeds. Unfortunately, she has just signed up to work for the boss from hell, whose cruel personality and outrageous demands make her life a nightmare. Comedy drama, with Meryl Streep, Anne Hathaway, Stanley Tucci and Emily Blunt(n).(n)

programme.title: Raising Helen
programme.desc: A New York fashion designer's sister dies, leaving her the legal guardian of three children. Maintaining a glamorous Manhattan lifestyle while looking after the youngsters proves more complicated than expected, forcing her to choose between professional fulfilment and family loyalty. Comedy drama, starring Kate Hudson, John Corbett, Helen Mirren and Joan Cusack(n).(n)

programme.title: The Bad News Bears
programme.desc: A gruff former minor-league baseball player agrees to coach a team of youngsters. However, he is shocked by how woefully hopeless the would-be sports heroes really are. Gritting his teeth, he vows to do his best, with the help of an old girlfriend's talented daughter and a grim-faced biker. Comedy, starring Walter Matthau, Tatum O'Neal, Ben Piazza, Joyce Van Patten and Vic Morrow(n).(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Excitable beat cop Ben longs to work alongside his fiancee's brother, hard-boiled detective James, who does not think he has what it takes. James decides to show Ben that he is not cut out for the job by recruiting him to help bring a drug dealer to justice. Comedy sequel, starring Ice Cube, Kevin Hart and Olivia Munn(n).(n)

programme.title: Get Smart
programme.desc: Clumsy Maxwell Smart's dream to leave his desk job at a secret intelligence agency and become a fully-fledged spy comes true when the identities of all the agents are exposed. Maxwell's boss has no choice but to send him into action to battle a sinister terrorist organisation. Comedy, based on the 1960s TV series, with Steve Carell, Anne Hathaway, Dwayne Johnson, Alan Arkin, Terence Stamp and James Caan(n).(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia
programme.desc: A former member of a singing trio, now running a hotel on a Greek island, is reunited with her old bandmates for her daughter's wedding - but is surprised when three of her old flames also show up unexpectedly. The three men have been invited by the bride, who wants to find out which one of them is her father. Musical comedy, with a soundtrack of Abba songs, starring Meryl Streep, Pierce Brosnan, Julie Walters, Colin Firth, Stellan Skarsgard and Amanda Seyfried(n).(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Excitable beat cop Ben longs to work alongside his fiancee's brother, hard-boiled detective James, who does not think he has what it takes. James decides to show Ben that he is not cut out for the job by recruiting him to help bring a drug dealer to justice. Comedy sequel, starring Ice Cube, Kevin Hart and Olivia Munn(n).(n)

programme.title: Notting Hill
programme.desc: A recently divorced bookshop owner finds love with a glamorous Hollywood film star, but ends up the focus of unwanted media interest - which makes maintaining a relationship a tricky proposition. Romantic comedy written by Richard Curtis, starring Hugh Grant, Julia Roberts, Rhys Ifans, Emma Chambers, James Dreyfus and Gina McKee(n).(n)

programme.title: Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story
programme.desc: The struggling owner of a run-down gym is forced to take drastic action to prevent an arrogant fitness guru buying the business out from under him - and enlists his customers to form a dodgeball team in the hope of triumphing in the US championships. Sporting comedy, starring Ben Stiller, Vince Vaughn and Christine Taylor(n).(n)

programme.title: Me, Myself and Irene
programme.desc: A mild-mannered state trooper bottles up his frustrations for years, causing him to develop a split personality. His alter ego is not quite as easy-going - a problem exacerbated when he falls in love and the two sides of his personality become rivals. Comedy from the Farrelly brothers, starring Jim Carrey, Renee Zellweger, Anthony Anderson, Mongo Brownlee and Robert Forster(n).(n)

programme.title: Barely Lethal
programme.desc: A teenage secret agent longs to lead a normal life, so decides to fake her own death and enrol in a high school as an exchange student. However, she soon discovers that navigating teenage social hierarchy can be just as dangerous as international espionage. Action comedy, starring Hailee Steinfeld, Samuel L Jackson and Jessica Alba(n).(n)

programme.title: Sully: Special
programme.desc: A look at the blockbusting biopic of hero pilot Chesley `Sully' Sullenberger, directed by Clint Eastwood and starring Tom Hanks(n).(n)

programme.title: Bad News Bears
programme.desc: A washed-up and embittered baseball player struggles with bad memories of a failed sports career. When his exasperated lawyer suggests he coach a losing Little-League team, he begins to turn himself and the youngsters into a force to be reckoned with. Richard Linklater's remake of the 1970s comedy, starring Billy Bob Thornton, Greg Kinnear, Marcia Gay Harden and Emmanuel Estrada(n).(n)

programme.title: The Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear
programme.desc: Blundering cop Frank Drebin discovers a secret conspiracy to kidnap a renowned solar energy expert and replace him with an imposter. As he sets out to bring the perpetrators to justice, he is unexpectedly reunited with an old flame. Slapstick comedy sequel, starring Leslie Nielsen, Priscilla Presley, George Kennedy, Richard Griffiths and OJ Simpson(n).(n)

programme.title: When Harry Met Sally
programme.desc: A man and a woman with different attitudes to life meet by chance and develop a close and long-lasting friendship. But over time, a mutual sexual attraction begins to develop and threatens to ruin their relationship - raising the question whether men and women can ever really be just friends. Romantic comedy, starring Billy Crystal and Meg Ryan(n).(n)

programme.title: Welcome to Me
programme.desc: A mentally unstable woman whose life revolves entirely around daytime TV wins the lottery. She immediately stops taking her medication and pays a television studio millions to let her broadcast a show sharing her outlandish views and troubled past with the world. Comedy, Kristen Kirsten Wiig and Tim Robbins(n).(n)

programme.title: Nine Months
programme.desc: A child psychologist's well-ordered world begins to fall apart when his live-in girlfriend announces she is pregnant. Not fond of children anyway, he dreads the impact a baby will make on his life - and to make matters worse, their eccentric Russian obstetrician admits he has never delivered a baby before. Romantic comedy, starring Hugh Grant, Julianne Moore, Jeff Goldblum, Joan Cusack and Tom Arnold, with Robin Williams in a cameo role(n).(n)

programme.title: Loser
programme.desc: A hard-working college student is branded a loser by his roommates, who promptly oust him from their group. When he helps a girl deal with an unpleasant drugs-related experience, he falls madly in love with her - but she only has eyes for a professor. Comedy, starring Jason Biggs, Mena Suvari, Greg Kinnear, Zak Orth, Thomas Sadoski and Dan Aykroyd(n).(n)

programme.title: Bad Santa
programme.desc: A grumpy alcoholic safe-cracker takes a job as an in-store Father Christmas with a view to robbing his employers' premises - but a bullied child, a barmaid with a Santa fetish and an overzealous security guard look set to wreck his plans for an inside job. Black comedy, starring Billy Bob Thornton, Tony Cox, Brett Kelly, Lauren Graham, Bernie Mac and John Ritter(n).(n)

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2
programme.desc: The bumbling security guard is invited to attend a conference in Las Vegas, and brings his teenage daughter along for a family holiday before she leaves for college. However, he is forced to leap into action when he uncovers a gang of criminals are plotting a casino heist. Comedy, starring Kevin James and Raini Rodriguez(n).(n)

programme.title: The Second Best Exotic Marigold Hotel
programme.desc: With the original Best Exotic Marigold Hotel a roaring success, owner Sonny decides the time is right to expand his business empire. But to do so, he and the rest of the residents must pull out all the stops to impress a potential investor's inspector - a task that proves to be easier said than done. Comedy drama sequel, with Dev Patel, Maggie Smith, Judi Dench and Richard Gere(n).(n)

programme.title: Loser
programme.desc: A hard-working college student is branded a loser by his roommates, who promptly oust him from their group. When he helps a girl deal with an unpleasant drugs-related experience, he falls madly in love with her - but she only has eyes for a professor. Comedy, starring Jason Biggs, Mena Suvari, Greg Kinnear, Zak Orth, Thomas Sadoski and Dan Aykroyd(n).(n)

programme.title: Entourage
programme.desc: Movie star Vincent Chase gets the chance of a lifetime when his former agent, now a studio executive, offers him the opportunity to direct and star in his latest picture. However, the project proves a troubled one, while his three best friends seek to exploit the situation to their own advantage. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Adrian Grenier, Kevin Connolly, Kevin Dillon and Jerry Ferrara(n).(n)

programme.title: Superman II
programme.desc: The Man of Steel meets his match in the form of three fugitive villains from his home planet of Krypton. Flying down to Earth, the super-powered trio unleash a reign of terror in a bid to take over the world - but Superman is not there to stop them, having surrendered his powers to lead a normal life with his beloved Lois Lane. Comic-strip adventure sequel, with Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Terence Stamp and Margot Kidder(n).(n)

programme.title: Black Sea
programme.desc: A submarine captain working for a salvage company is laid off, and attempts to turn his fortunes around by recovering a lost treasure rumoured to have sunk to the depths of the Black Sea. However, greed, desperation and claustrophobia cause the members of his crew to turn against each other. Thriller, starring Jude Law and Jodie Whittaker(n).(n)

programme.title: Godzilla
programme.desc: A giant mutant lizard spawned from an atomic test rampages through the streets of New York, defying the combined might of the US Army and Navy as it searches for a quiet place to hatch its eggs. A bookish radiation expert and a shady French secret agent join forces to defeat the creature. Hollywood remake of the Japanese monster adventure, starring Matthew Broderick, Jean Reno, Maria Pitillo and Hank Azaria(n).(n)

programme.title: Taken 3
programme.desc: Ex-CIA agent Bryan Mills' efforts to finally live a quiet life are shattered by the death of his ex-wife. Just when things seemingly can't get any worse, he is framed for her murder and must fight to clear his name. Action thriller sequel, starring Liam Neeson, Forest Whitaker and Maggie Grace(n).(n)

programme.title: Fast & Furious 7
programme.desc: After defeating Owen Shaw and his crew and securing amnesty for their past crimes, Dom, Brian and the rest of the team return home to live normal lives again. However Shaw's older brother Deckard - a rogue special forces assassin vows revenge on Dom, who he holds responsible for leaving Owen in a coma. Action thriller sequel, starring Vin Diesel, Jason Statham and Paul Walker in his last film role(n).(n)

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: Oppressed Mexican villagers cross the border into America looking to buy guns to defend their homes and crops from bandits. Instead they encounter an enigmatic loner who persuades them to hire a band of gunslingers to teach the villagers how to fight before the marauders return. Western, with Yul Brynner, Steve McQueen, Charles Bronson, Robert Vaughn, James Coburn and Eli Wallach(n).(n)

programme.title: The Rock
programme.desc: A renegade general and his crack team of mercenaries take over the abandoned fortress prison of Alcatraz and threaten San Francisco with toxic nerve-gas rockets to extort a massive ransom. To break their stranglehold on the city, the FBI sends in a chemical weapons expert and a jailed SAS veteran, chosen because he is the only man to have ever escaped from the infamous penitentiary. Action thriller, with Sean Connery, Nicolas Cage and Ed Harris(n).(n)

programme.title: The Marine 4: Moving Target
programme.desc: Hard-bitten marine Jake Carter is ordered to protect a beautiful whistleblower. She has evidence that will prove a powerful military defence contractor is corrupt, and is willing to put her life on the line to do so. Action thriller sequel, starring Mike 'The Miz' Mizanin, Summer Rae and Melissa Roxburgh(n).(n)

programme.title: Superman III
programme.desc: The Man of Steel battles an evil tycoon, who has recruited a computer genius to aid his schemes for world domination. Together the villains hatch a plan to dispose of Superman once and for all - but instead of killing the superhero, they accidentally unveil his dark side. Comic-book adventure sequel, starring Christopher Reeve, Richard Pryor, Robert Vaughn and Margot Kidder(n).(n)

programme.title: Behind Enemy Lines
programme.desc: A reconnaissance pilot is shot down and becomes stranded in enemy territory after filming evidence of a genocidal massacre by Serb militia in Bosnia. The naval air commander for Nato forces in the Balkans defies orders by mounting an unauthorised mission to rescue him, while the airman faces a battle to stay alive as he is pursued by paramilitary forces. Bosnian War drama, starring Gene Hackman, Owen Wilson, Gabriel Macht and Olek Krupa(n).(n)

programme.title: Sword of Vengeance
programme.desc: In 11th century Britain, a mysterious stranger known only as Shadow Walker returns home after years in slavery and immediately turns a group of local men into ruthless killers - but do they have the ability to overthrow their tyrannical ruler? Action adventure, with Stanley Weber and Annabelle Wallis(n).(n)

programme.title: I Am Wrath
programme.desc: A grieving widower is shocked when his wife's killers manage to evade justice, so he seeks the aid of an old friend in taking the law into his own hands. However, as he hunts down the murderers, he discovers they have friends in very high places. Crime thriller, starring John Travolta and Christopher Meloni(n).(n)

programme.title: Hitman: Agent 47
programme.desc: The latest in a long line of genetically engineered clones bred to be the perfect assassin takes on a mission that strikes close to home. A corporation intends to use the technology that created him to build an army of superhuman killers. As the assassin fights to bring them down, he uncovers the dark secrets surrounding his origin. Action thriller, starring Rupert Friend, Hannah Ware and Zachary Quinto(n).(n)

programme.title: San Andreas
programme.desc: In the aftermath of a massive earthquake in California, a Los Angeles rescue-chopper pilot makes a dangerous journey with his ex-wife across the state to try and rescue his daughter. Disaster movie, starring Dwayne Johnson and Carla Gugino(n).(n)

programme.title: Camino
programme.desc: A photographer ventures deep into the jungles of Colombia to document a group of missionaries. However, when she witnesses the leader of the group committing a horrific crime, she faces a battle for survival to make it back to civilisation with the evidence before his followers have her killed. Action thriller, starring Zoe Bell and Nacho Vigalondo(n).(n)

programme.title: Demolition Man
programme.desc: Maverick cop John Spartan is frozen alive in 1996 and held in cryonic suspension for a crime he did not commit. Decades into the future, the dictator of a seemingly utopian city unleashes a criminal psychopath against his political enemy - but he proves impossible to control, forcing the authorities to revive Spartan to defeat him. Sci-fi thriller, with Sylvester Stallone, Wesley Snipes, Sandra Bullock and Nigel Hawthorne(n).(n)

programme.title: Assassin
programme.desc: A hitman is hired by two notorious gangster brothers to murder a politician. He falls for a woman during the assignment, but does not realise she is his victim's daughter. Her investigation of her father's death threatens to cause a gang war and puts the assassin at odds with his employers. Crime thriller, starring Danny Dyer, Gary and Martin Kemp(n).(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show 2016
programme.desc: Countdown of the biggest box office hits in Britain and America(n).(n)

programme.title: Superman IV: The Quest for Peace
programme.desc: The Man of Steel embarks on a mission to destroy every nuclear weapon on the planet. However, his arch-enemy Lex Luthor sees the chance to rid himself of the superhero by creating a deadly radioactive henchman who causes havoc around the world. Comic-book adventure sequel, starring Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Mark Pillow and Margot Kidder(n).(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them: Special
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the latest trip into JK Rowling's wizarding world, including interviews with stars Eddie Redmayne and Colin Farrell(n).(n)

programme.title: Unbroken
programme.desc: An Olympic athlete enlists in the US Air Force during the Second World War. When his plane is shot down, he and two crewmates survive for 33 days lost at sea. Worse is to come when they are captured by Japanese forces, and he endures brutal treatment in a PoW camp run by an infamous war criminal. Fact-based Second World War drama, directed by Angelina Jolie and starring Jack O'Connell and Domhnall Gleeson(n).(n)

programme.title: The Scorpion King
programme.desc: A ruthless warlord resolves to rid the desert of its few remaining tribes, prompting them to seek the help of a legendary assassin to end the despot's reign of terror by destroying his source of power - a beautiful but deadly sorceress. Fantasy action adventure, starring Dwayne Johnson, Steven Brand, Kelly Hu and Michael Clarke Duncan(n).(n)

programme.title: Dragonball Z: Battle of Gods
programme.desc: A team of super-powered warriors who once saved Earth reunites to face a new threat. An ancient god of destruction awakens and seeks them out in search of a new challenge. The leader of the band of heroes must find a way to increase his own powers to match his enemy in battle. Animated fantasy adventure, with the voices of Sean Schemmel and Jason Douglas(n).(n)

programme.title: Spectre
programme.desc: James Bond goes rogue after receiving a cryptic message that sets him on the trail of a secretive criminal network. While his colleagues face a new threat closer to home, Bond embarks on a globetrotting journey in search of the elusive mastermind behind the syndicate - whom he discovers may have links to his own past. Spy thriller, starring Daniel Craig, Christoph Waltz, Lea Seydoux and Ralph Fiennes(n).(n)

programme.title: Everest
programme.desc: Two expeditions set out to climb to the summit of the world's highest mountain. Both parties of mountaineers get caught in one of the fiercest snowstorms ever recorded, and face a desperate struggle to survive against the elements. Fact-based adventure, starring Jason Clarke, Josh Brolin, Jake Gyllenhaal and Keira Knightley(n).(n)

programme.title: Armageddon
programme.desc: Nasa discovers an asteroid the size of Texas is on a collision course with Earth, so a drilling expert is recruited to train a team of misfits to transport a nuclear device into outer space to destroy it - but having had no experience of space travel, the reluctant astronauts find themselves seriously out of their depth. Sci-fi thriller, with Bruce Willis, Ben Affleck, Liv Tyler, Michael Clarke Duncan, Billy Bob Thornton and Steve Buscemi(n).(n)

programme.title: The Scorpion King

programme.title: The Poseidon Adventure
programme.desc: A luxury cruise liner at sea on New Year's Eve is struck by a freak tidal wave, which leaves it capsized and several passengers and crew trapped. A rebellious priest realises the ship is sinking fast, and leads a band of survivors up through the vessel in search of a way to the surface. Disaster movie, starring Gene Hackman, Ernest Borgnine, Shelley Winters, Leslie Nielsen and Roddy McDowall(n).(n)

programme.title: Twins
programme.desc: An unlikely pair of brothers, who were born as the result of a one-off genetic experiment and separated at birth, are reunited in adulthood. They set out on a cross-country search for their unknown mother - fending off vicious loan sharks and a professional assassin along the way. Comedy, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Danny DeVito, Kelly Preston and Chloe Webb(n).(n)

programme.title: US Marshals
programme.desc: A federal marshal sets out in pursuit of an escaped prisoner who is determined to prove his murder conviction was false. As the chase progresses, the marshal is forced to work with a diplomatic security agent, making him realise the fugitive is no ordinary convict and that his claims of innocence may be true. Thriller sequel, starring Tommy Lee Jones reprising his Oscar-winning role from The Fugitive, alongside Wesley Snipes and Robert Downey Jr(n).(n)

programme.title: Roustabout
programme.desc: A leather-clad drifter with a talent for all things tuneful joins a travelling carnival, and catches the eye of a co-worker - but her father is less less than keen on the relationship, leading to trouble. Musical, starring Elvis Presley, Barbara Stanwyck, Joan Freeman, Leif Erickson and Sue Ann Langdon(n).(n)

programme.title: Steel Magnolias
programme.desc: The close friendship of six women from different generations, living in a backwoods town in America's Deep South, sustains them through life's joys and disappointments. Drama based on the play by Robert Harling, starring Sally Field, Julia Roberts, Dolly Parton, Shirley MacLaine, Olympia Dukakis, Daryl Hannah and Sam Shepard(n).(n)

programme.title: Smokey and the Bandit
programme.desc: A truck driver accepts a challenge to deliver a consignment of beer to a party. He claims he can make the 900-mile round trip in just 28 hours, but a pompous sheriff is determined to stop him in his tracks, not least because his prospective daughter-in-law has deserted his son and hitched a ride with the unlikely hero. Comedy, starring Burt Reynolds, Jackie Gleason, Sally Field and Jerry Reed(n).(n)

Thriller sequel, starring Tommy Lee Jones reprising his Oscar-winning role from The Fugitive, alongside Wesley Snipes and Robert Downey Jr(n).(n)

programme.title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
programme.desc: A rebellious convict gets himself sent to a psychiatric hospital, thinking it will be easier than prison. Finding himself surrounded by institutionalised patients, he encourages them to rebel against the tyrannical head nurse. Milos Forman's Oscar-winning drama based on Ken Kesey's novel, starring Jack Nicholson, Louise Fletcher, Brad Dourif and Danny DeVito(n).(n)

programme.title: The Hustler
programme.desc: An arrogant pool shark challenges a renowned champion player, only to lose the match and end up broke with his confidence shattered. With the aid of a cut-throat manager, he sets about honing his skills for a rematch - but making it to the top could cost him everything. Oscar-winning drama, starring Paul Newman, Jackie Gleason, George C Scott, Piper Laurie, Murray Hamilton and Myron McCormick(n).(n)

programme.title: Smokey and the Bandit
programme.desc: A truck driver accepts a challenge to deliver a consignment of beer to a party. He claims he can make the 900-mile round trip in just 28 hours, but a pompous sheriff is determined to stop him in his tracks, not least because his prospective daughter-in-law has deserted his son and hitched a ride with the unlikely hero. Comedy, starring Burt Reynolds, Jackie Gleason, Sally Field and Jerry Reed(n).(n)

programme.title: The Poseidon Adventure
programme.desc: A luxury cruise liner at sea on New Year's Eve is struck by a freak tidal wave, which leaves it capsized and several passengers and crew trapped. A rebellious priest realises the ship is sinking fast, and leads a band of survivors up through the vessel in search of a way to the surface. Disaster movie, starring Gene Hackman, Ernest Borgnine, Shelley Winters, Leslie Nielsen and Roddy McDowall(n).(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Robin Hood
programme.desc: An outlawed nobleman living deep in Sherwood Forest recruits a band of merry men to steal from the cruel Norman aristocracy and redistribute the wealth to the downtrodden peasants. However, they soon face a more pressing task - stopping the evil Prince John and his ally Sir Guy of Gisborne from seizing King Richard's throne. Swashbuckling adventure, with Errol Flynn, Olivia de Havilland, Basil Rathbone and Claude Rains(n).(n)

programme.title: Who Framed Roger Rabbit
programme.desc: Comedy mixing live action and animation, set in a 1940s Hollywood where cartoon characters are real. A seedy private eye with a hatred of `toons' reluctantly ends up helping to clear an animated rabbit accused of murdering his wife's human lover. Starring Bob Hoskins, Christopher Lloyd, Joanna Cassidy and Stubby Kaye, with voices supplied by Mel Blanc, Kathleen Turner and Charles Fleischer(n).(n)

programme.title: Inception
programme.desc: A talented thief uses hi-tech devices to enter other people's dreams so he can steal their secrets. An industrialist hires him to perform a far more challenging job - to implant an idea into a corporate heir's mind, so he will think it is his own. However, the mission is compromised by the thief's own troubled psyche. Christopher Nolan's sci-fi thriller, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Ellen Page, Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Tom Hardy(n).(n)

programme.title: Amadeus: The Director's Cut
programme.desc: Composer Antonio Salieri is a favoured artist in the court of Austrian emperor Joseph II, but he finds himself pushed aside in favour of a young Mozart. Salieri admires the younger maestro's music, but is incensed that someone so vulgar and obnoxious should be gifted with such talent, and as jealousy consumes him, he plots his rival's downfall. Extended cut of Milos Forman's period drama, adapted by Peter Shaffer from his own play and starring F Murray Abraham and Tom Hulce(n).(n)

programme.title: Smokey and the Bandit II
programme.desc: The maverick haulier must overcome a crisis of confidence when he and his friends are hired to transport a pregnant elephant to Texas, a mammoth task that proves far from easy, especially with their old enemy in hot pursuit. Road comedy, with Burt Reynolds, Jackie Gleason, Jerry Reed, Dom DeLuise and Sally Field(n).(n)

programme.title: The Usual Suspects
programme.desc: Five criminals are brought together by a police line-up, and decide to join forces to pull off one more big job. However, they discover their meeting was not a coincidence and that a mysterious crime lord has plans for them. Bryan Singer's Oscar-winning thriller, starring Gabriel Byrne, Kevin Spacey, Benicio Del Toro, Kevin Pollak, Stephen Baldwin, Pete Postlethwaite, Chazz Palminteri and Suzy Amis(n).(n)

programme.title: A Clockwork Orange
programme.desc: Sadistic young gang leader Alex leads a carefree life indulging his love of rape, violence and classical music. When he is finally arrested, he is subjected to a sinister form of aversion therapy that brainwashes him into being physically unable to use violence. However, on his release, he finds friends and family have turned on him, while others seek to exploit him to further their political ends. Drama, starring Malcolm McDowell and Warren Clarke(n).(n)

programme.title: Smokey and the Bandit II
programme.desc: The maverick haulier must overcome a crisis of confidence when he and his friends are hired to transport a pregnant elephant to Texas, a mammoth task that proves far from easy, especially with their old enemy in hot pursuit. Road comedy, with Burt Reynolds, Jackie Gleason, Jerry Reed, Dom DeLuise and Sally Field(n).(n)

Swashbuckling adventure, with Errol Flynn, Olivia de Havilland, Basil Rathbone and Claude Rains(n).(n)

A bureaucrat in a totalitarian society whose populace are kept under constant surveillance begins to question the regime he works for, and begins a secret, illegal relationship with a fellow subversive. However, their small rebellion is doomed to end in tragedy. Futuristic drama based on George Orwell's novel, starring John Hurt Richard Burton and Suzanna Hamilton(n).(n)

programme.title: Mary Poppins
programme.desc: A practically perfect Edwardian nanny brings magical fun, laughter and adventure into the humdrum lives of a young brother and sister - much to the alarm of their disciplinarian father. Disney's musical fantasy based on PL Travers' novel, starring Julie Andrews, Dick Van Dyke, Glynis Johns, David Tomlinson, Karen Dotrice and Matthew Garber(n).(n)

programme.title: Matilda
programme.desc: A gifted youngster is packed off by her selfish parents to the prison-like Crunchem Hall School. Once there, she befriends a sweet-natured teacher who convinces her that not all grown-ups are bad - and urges her to use her special powers to turn the tables on the nasty headmistress. Fantasy comedy, adapted from the children's book by Roald Dahl, with Mara Wilson, Pam Ferris, Embeth Davidtz, Rhea Perlman and Danny DeVito, who also directed(n).(n)

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: Two men receive life sentences for a crime they did not commit. Once behind bars, their situation becomes even more dire when they discover petty differences can easily be magnified into reasons for all-out war. Comedy, starring Eddie Murphy, Martin Lawrence, Ned Beatty, Rick James, Bernie Mac, Bokeem Woodbine and Obba Babatunde(n).(n)

programme.title: Big Jake
programme.desc: Bandits attack a Texas ranch and kidnap a boy, demanding a $1million ransom. However, they have reckoned without the intervention of the youngster's tough grandfather, who sets out on the trail with the aid of his two sons, a cunning tracker and his faithful dog. Western, starring John Wayne, Richard Boone, Maureen O'Hara, Chris Mitchum and Patrick Wayne(n).(n)

programme.title: Smokey and the Bandit Part 3
programme.desc: Sheriff Buford T Justice (Jackie Gleason), now reluctantly nearing retirement, accepts a wild challenge to race from Miami to Texas in less than 24 hours. Comedy adventure, also starring Jerry Reed, Mike Henry and featuring a cameo appearance by Burt Reynolds(n).(n)

programme.title: Sunshine
programme.desc: Fifty years in the future, Earth faces extinction, so a spacecraft sets out to reignite the sun with an experimental nuclear device. The crew intercepts a message from a previous ship, which disappeared - but the unexpected contact sets off a dangerous chain of events. Danny Boyle's sci-fi thriller, starring Cillian Murphy, Chris Evans, Michelle Yeoh and Rose Byrne(n).(n)

programme.title: Treasure Buddies
programme.desc: Five golden retriever puppies embark on a danger-filled quest halfway across the world as they search for the greatest treasure known to animalkind. Arriving in Egypt, the canine explorers make some new exotic friends and search through ancient ruins as they try to stop devious sphynx cat Ubasti from claiming their prize. Family adventure sequel, with the voices of Skyler Gisondo and Elaine Hendrix(n).(n)

programme.title: Peter Pan
programme.desc: Three children are visited in the night by a magical flying boy and a fairy named Tinker Bell. The strange youngster takes them away to his home, the magical island of Neverland, where his band of runaway youngsters are engaged in an ongoing battle with a crew of pirates. Disney animated adventure based on JM Barrie's novel, with the voices of Bobby Driscoll and Hans Conried(n).(n)

programme.title: Big Hero 6
programme.desc: A lonely, orphaned computer genius forms a special bond with an inflatable robot. When a devastating event occurs in their futuristic home city, they join forces with a group of friends to form a hi-tech group of heroes who are determined to get to the bottom of the matter. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Ryan Potter, Scott Adsit and Daniel Henney(n).(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Inside 11-year-old Riley's head lives a team of five that controls her emotions. Led by the eternally upbeat Joy, they have always ensured she lived a happy life - but when Riley's parents move to a new city, she is plunged into depression and the emotions face a crisis that threatens their entire world. Pixar animated fantasy, with the voices of Amy Poehler and Phyllis Smith(n).(n)

programme.title: Alice in Wonderland
programme.desc: A 19-year-old Alice returns to the magical land, having forgotten her previous adventures. She finds the tyrannical Red Queen has begun a reign of terror that can only be ended by slaying the monstrous Jabberwocky - a task she is seemingly destined to attempt. Tim Burton's fantasy adventure based on Lewis Carroll's novels, starring Mia Wasikowska, Johnny Depp, Helena Bonham Carter and Anne Hathaway(n).(n)

programme.title: Bolt
programme.desc: The canine star of a TV show about a dog with superpowers thinks his on-screen adventures and abilities are all real. When he accidentally gets mailed across America, he sets off on a frantic journey to battle against the evil he thinks is waiting for him - but along the way, he comes to realise he is just a normal dog. Animated adventure, with the voices of John Travolta and Miley Cyrus(n).(n)

programme.title: Alice in Wonderland
programme.desc: A 19-year-old Alice returns to the magical land, having forgotten her previous adventures. Tim Burton's fantasy adventure based on Lewis Carroll's novels, starring Mia Wasikowska, Johnny Depp, Helena Bonham Carter and Anne Hathaway(n).(n)

programme.title: The Finest Hours
programme.desc: An oil tanker suffers devastating damage while caught in a fierce Atlantic storm, which breaks the vessel in two. While an engineer tries to keep the crew members trapped in the sinking wreckage alive, members of the Coast Guard brave the deadly conditions to come to their rescue. Fact-based disaster movie, starring Chris Pine, Casey Affleck and Eric Bana(n).(n)

programme.title: Tron
programme.desc: A computer genius hacks into the mainframe of the company he used to work for, hoping to find evidence against the executive who stole his ideas. However, the intelligent master program running the system transports him into an electronic world, where he is forced to battle gladiators in a series of deadly games. Disney sci-fi adventure, starring Jeff Bridges, Bruce Boxleitner and David Warner(n).(n)

programme.title: Homeward Bound II: Lost in San Francisco
programme.desc: Two dogs and a cat are left to fend for themselves on the streets of San Francisco when their owners fly off on holiday and accidentally leave them behind. As they join a tough group of strays, they must avoid falling into the clutches of the sinister dog catchers. Adventure sequel, with the voices of Michael J Fox, Sally Field and Ralph Waite(n).(n)

programme.title: The Cat from Outer Space
programme.desc: A UFO crash-lands on Earth and its only occupant is an alien cat whose collar gives him strange powers, including the ability to communicate telepathically with humans. This turns out to be a useful skill when he is forced to enlist help to get his spaceship back after the US government seizes it. Disney sci-fi comedy, with Roddy McDowall and Sandy Duncan(n).(n)

programme.title: Beverly Hills Chihuahua 2
programme.desc: A canine couple adjusting to parenthood with a litter of five puppies discover their owner's parents face losing their home. They leap into action to help their human friends, hatching a plan to raise the money needed by robbing banks and competing in dog shows. Comedy, starring Marcus Coloma, with the voices of Odette Annable and George Lopez(n).(n)

programme.title: Tinker Bell and the Legend of the NeverBeast
programme.desc: One of Tinker Bell's friends meets a large hairy monster, and discovers he is not as fearsome as he looks. However, she has a hard time convincing the other fairies to accept him, and needs the help of her friends to protect the creature. Animated fantasy, with the voices of Mae Whitman, Ginnifer Goodwin and Rosario Dawson(n).(n)

programme.title: WALL.E
programme.desc: In the far future, waste collection robot WALL.E is the only unit left to clean up a desolate and dilapidated Earth. But when a survey droid arrives to search for any signs of life, WALL.E is lovestruck and hitches a ride on the spaceship sent to collect her, embarking on a journey that could determine the future of the human race. Pixar animated sci-fi adventure, with the voices of Ben Burtt, Elissa Knight, Jeff Garlin, Fred Willard and Sigourney Weaver(n).(n)

programme.title: The Santa Clause
programme.desc: A grumpy divorced father faces a dilemma one Christmas Eve after accidentally startling Santa and causing him to fall to his death. The guilty man's only option is to put on the red suit, jump into the sleigh and finish the round himself, much to his son's delight. Fantasy comedy, starring Tim Allen, Judge Reinhold, Wendy Crewson, Eric Lloyd and David Krumholtz(n).(n)

programme.title: Race to Witch Mountain
programme.desc: An ex-convict cab driver becomes the protector of two aliens disguised as children who claim to hold the key to Earth's continued existence. As he races against time to return the visitors to their spaceship, he must also hold off hostile government agents and a sinister extraterrestrial assassin. Sci-fi adventure, starring Dwayne Johnson, AnnaSophia Robb, Alexander Ludwig and Carla Gugino(n).(n)

programme.title: The Emperor's New Groove
programme.desc: A spoilt and uncaring emperor learns the importance of treating people fairly when a sorceress turns him into a llama so she can seize power herself. His only hope of getting his kingdom back is to seek the help of a peasant he had previously mistreated. Animated Disney comedy, featuring the voices of David Spade, John Goodman, Patrick Warburton and Eartha Kitt(n).(n)

programme.title: Toy Story
programme.desc: A jealous string-pulled cowboy doll's status as his owner's favourite plaything is threatened by the arrival of a charismatic hi-tech astronaut figure, who refuses to believe he is simply a toy. However, the rivals are forced to work together when they are left stranded in the outside world. Pixar animated adventure, featuring the voices of Tom Hanks, Tim Allen, Don Rickles and Jim Varney(n).(n)

programme.title: Feast
programme.desc: A dog named Winston loves eating, until his owner feeds him vegetables. Animated short, directed by Patrick Osborne(n).(n)

Sci-fi adventure, starring Dwayne Johnson, AnnaSophia Robb, Alexander Ludwig and Carla Gugino(n).(n)

programme.title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
programme.desc: A deformed bell-ringer living reclusively in a cathedral in the heart of medieval Paris is tempted out of seclusion when a gypsy festival arrives and captures his imagination. Here in the outside world, he learns the cruel government minister who raised him is hatching a plan to wipe out the gypsies, so he resolves to protect his new friends. Disney animation, with the voices of Tom Hulce, Demi Moore and Kevin Kline(n).(n)

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: A basketball coach takes over a college team in 1960s Texas, but his decision to recruit black people causes uproar. Determined to enlist the best players possible, he sets out to lead his team to the national championships. Sporting drama based on a true story, starring Josh Lucas, Jon Voight and Derek Luke(n).(n)

programme.title: Invincible
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck barman is having a hard time coping after his wife leaves him and he loses his teaching job. His fortunes turn around when the American football team he has supported all his life holds open trials and, against all odds, he wins a place on the squad. Fact-based sporting drama, starring Mark Wahlberg, Greg Kinnear and Elizabeth Banks(n).(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Journey
programme.desc: The owners of a cat and two dogs leave their pets with a friend in a remote area of Canada while they take a holiday abroad. When the minder embarks on a hunting trip, the three animals find themselves unattended and set out on a hazardous journey through the wilderness to get back home. Disney adventure, starring Emile Genest and John Drainie(n).(n)

programme.title: Presto
programme.desc: Animated short comedy from Pixar about a magician preparing for a performance who once again forgets to feed his rabbit before going on stage. However, the animal has had enough of going hungry and plots to ruin the show. Directed and voiced by Doug Sweetland(n).(n)

programme.title: Tin Toy
programme.desc: Pixar animated short by Toy Story director John Lasseter about a tin one-man-band toy trying to escape a destructive baby(n).(n)

programme.title: Sanjay's Super Team
programme.desc: Bored with his father's meditation, a young Indian boy daydreams of Hindu gods as superheroes. Animated short, with the voices of Brent Schraff, Sunny Singh Attar, Arun Rao and Jaquelynn Herrera(n).(n)

programme.title: The Fox and the Hound
programme.desc: An orphaned fox cub is taken in by a kindly widow, and becomes firm friends with a puppy belonging to a hunter. However, as they grow to adulthood, the dog is trained to prey on foxes, and the two animals realise their friendship may not survive as they are expected to be natural enemies. Animated adventure, with the voices of Mickey Rooney and Kurt Russell(n).(n)

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: An orphaned girl is treated as a servant by her cruel stepmother and her two daughters. Her life is changed for ever by the intervention of a kindly fairy godmother, who gives her the opportunity to attend a lavish royal and win the heart of a handsome prince. Romantic fantasy, starring Lily James, Cate Blanchett, Richard Madden and Helena Bonham Carter(n).(n)

programme.title: Pocahontas
programme.desc: A Native American princess falls in love with an English settler, but her father is distrustful of the Europeans - not without just cause, as a cruel governor is prepared to wage war to get his hands on the gold he believes they are hiding. Disney animated drama, with the voices of Irene Bedard, Mel Gibson and Christian Bale(n).(n)

programme.title: National Treasure: Book of Secrets
programme.desc: Intrepid archaeologist Ben Gates sets out to clear the family name when evidence emerges that an ancestor was involved in the assassination of Abraham Lincoln. His mission leads him on another globe-trotting treasure hunt that uncovers a secret conspiracy. Adventure sequel, starring Nicolas Cage, Helen Mirren, Ed Harris, Harvey Keitel and Jon Voight(n).(n)

programme.title: Aladdin
programme.desc: A street urchin is caught up in a scheming grand vizier's plot to get his clutches on a magical lamp. Retrieving the object from a wondrous cave, he releases a powerful genie trapped inside, whose ability to grant wishes helps the young hero thwart the villain's plans and woo a princess. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Robin Williams, Scott Weinger and Linda Larkin(n).(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright(n).(n)

programme.title: The Watcher in the Woods
programme.desc: Two sisters are haunted by a ghost when they and their American family move into an old mansion set deep in an English forest. As the spirit makes more and more contact with them, the girls come to realise that the spirit is the ghost of the owner's child who went missing long ago. Thriller, starring Bette Davis, Carroll Baker, David McCallum and Lynn-Holly Johnson(n).(n)

programme.title: Home Alone 4
programme.desc: Young Kevin McCallister has decided to spend Christmas with his father in a luxury mansion, but certain old acquaintances look set to ruin the festivities by burgling the property. The indomitable youngster decides to put the house's impressive range of hi-tech gadgetry to good use to try to see off the crooks. Comedy sequel, with Mike Weinberg, French Stewart, Missi Pyle, Jason Beghe and Joanna Going(n).(n)

programme.title: Garfield: A Tale of Two Kitties
programme.desc: The lazy moggy stows away in his owner's luggage and ends up in London. He is promptly mistaken for an English upper-class cat, who has recently inherited a grand estate, and moves into his stately home - much to the dismay of the real aristocratic feline's conniving relation, who is bent on swindling him out of his money. Family comedy, starring Breckin Meyer, Billy Connolly and Jennifer Love Hewitt, with the voices of Bill Murray and Tim Curry(n).(n)

programme.title: The Little Mermaid
programme.desc: Underwater princess Ariel becomes bored with her aquatic existence and spends her time spying on humans, much to the annoyance of her father. Longing to live on land, she strikes a deal with a banished sea witch in order to become human and meet a prince - but there is a price to be paid. Disney's animated adventure, with the voices of Jodi Benson, Christopher Daniel Barnes and Rene Auberjonois(n).(n)

programme.title: Capture the Flag
programme.desc: A young surfer and his friends try to prevent a devious plan to change the course of history when a ruthless billionaire sets out to stop the moon landings from happening, so that he can gain control of a valuable energy source. Animated sci-fi adventure, with the voices of Sam Fink, Phillipa Alexander and Lorraine Pilkington(n).(n)

programme.title: Jingle All the Way 2
programme.desc: A man is desperate to earn the love of his eight-year-old stepdaughter, so decides to get her the most popular toy in the shops for Christmas. programme.title: Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs

programme.title: Ghosthunters: On Icy Trails
programme.desc: A fearful young boy forms an unlikely bond with a loveable green ghost and tries to help him reclaim his haunted house. Family adventure, starring Anke Engelke, Milo Parker and the voice of Bastian Pastewka(n).(n)

programme.title: Garfield: A Tale of Two Kitties
programme.desc: The lazy moggy stows away in his owner's luggage and ends up in London. He is promptly mistaken for an English upper-class cat, who has recently inherited a grand estate, and moves into his stately home - much to the dismay of the real aristocratic feline's conniving relation, who is bent on swindling him out of his money. Family comedy, starring Breckin Meyer, Billy Connolly and Jennifer Love Hewitt, with the voices of Bill Murray and Tim Curry(n).(n)

programme.title: Dennis
programme.desc: A well-meaning little boy with an inability to stay out of trouble is the bane of his curmudgeonly neighbour, Mr Wilson. But when a thief steals Wilson's coin collection, the tiny terror seizes the chance to make amends and come to the rescue. Slapstick comedy based on the comic strip, starring Walter Matthau, Mason Gamble, Joan Plowright, Christopher Lloyd and Lea Thompson(n).(n)

programme.title: Ghosthunters: On Icy Trails
programme.desc: A fearful young boy forms an unlikely bond with a loveable green ghost and tries to help him reclaim his haunted house. Family adventure, starring Anke Engelke, Milo Parker and the voice of Bastian Pastewka(n).(n)

programme.title: Scooby-Doo
programme.desc: The hapless hound and his chums reunite after a bitter break-up to solve a baffling mystery in the ghost-themed tourist resort of Spooky Island, whose owner is convinced he has a genuine haunting on his hands. Live-action comedy adventure based on the cartoon series, starring Sarah Michelle Gellar, Matthew Lillard, Freddie Prinze Jr, Linda Cardellini and Rowan Atkinson(n).(n)

programme.title: Frog Games
programme.desc: The king of the land of frogs announces a major sporting event, with the promise that the overall champion will marry his daughter. The horrified princess runs away form home and disguises herself as a commoner, planning to enter the games herself and win - but she gets mixed up in the plans of an evil snake. Animated adventure, with the voices of Bella Thorne and Cameron Dallas(n).(n)

programme.title: The Nativity Story
programme.desc: A woman is visited by an angel and told she is to give birth to the son of God. While pregnant, she is forced to accompany her husband on an arduous journey to his birthplace, where King Herod knows of the prophecy and fears the birth of the child - and will go to any lengths to prevent it. Biblical drama, with Keisha Castle-Hughes, Oscar Isaac and Ciaran Hinds(n).(n)

programme.title: Prancer
programme.desc: A nine-year-old farm girl finds a wounded reindeer she is sure belongs to Father Christmas, and lovingly nurses it back to health. Although her innocent attempts to contact Santa about his missing animal embarrass her family, her gentle nature and determination eventually remind the local community just what Christmas is really all about. Drama, with Rebecca Harrell, Sam Elliott and Cloris Leachman(n).(n)

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 2
programme.desc: Dracula is worried that his half-human grandson is not showing any vampiric tendencies, so enlists the help of his fellow monsters in showing the youngster how it is done. The count is shocked to receive an unwelcome visit from his own father, who does not approve of his son's tolerance of humans. Animated comedy, with the voices of Adam Sandler and Andy Samberg(n).(n)

programme.title: The Water Horse: Legend of the Deep
programme.desc: A lonely boy living in the Scottish Highlands during the Second World War stumbles on a curiously large egg by the water's edge of the local loch. Astonishingly, it hatches into a cute baby sea monster and, although he tries his hardest to keep it concealed, the task is made almost impossible by the creature's alarming rate of growth. Children's fantasy adventure, based on the book by Dick King-Smith, with Alex Etel, Emily Watson and David Morrissey(n).(n)

programme.title: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang
programme.desc: Eccentric inventor Caractacus Potts rescues an old car from the scrapheap, only to discover it has magical, gravity-defying powers. Meanwhile, Baron Bomburst, the blundering ruler of Vulgaria, will do anything to get his greedy hands on it. Children's musical adventure, based on the book by Ian Fleming, starring Dick Van Dyke, Lionel Jeffries, Sally Ann Howes, Gert Frobe, Benny Hill and James Robertson Justice(n).(n)

programme.title: Babe
programme.desc: A kindly farmer wins a cute piglet, which some greedy humans and jealous animals hope will end up as the Christmas roast. Undaunted, the young pig proves himself useful on the farm and enlists the aid of the resident dog in learning how to herd sheep. Family comedy, starring James Cromwell and Magda Szubanski, with Christine Cavanaugh, Miriam Margolyes and Hugo Weaving among those providing the voices of the animal characters(n).(n)

programme.title: Babe: Pig in the City
programme.desc: The pig and his farmyard pals take a trip to the big city, where their curiosity and love of adventure lands them in trouble, leaving the courageous Babe to find a way to save his chums from danger. Family comedy sequel, starring Magda Szubanski, Mickey Rooney and James Cromwell, and featuring the voice of Elizabeth Daily as Babe(n).(n)

programme.title: Jack Frost
programme.desc: A rock musician who realises he is spending too much time away from his family is killed in a car accident while travelling home for the festive season. The following year his spirit takes on the form of a snowman, made by his son, allowing them to spend one last Christmas together. Fantasy drama, starring Michael Keaton, Kelly Preston, Joseph Cross and Mark Addy(n).(n)

programme.title: Saving Santa
programme.desc: Bernard, a clumsy elf working in Santa's reindeer stables, learns that his employer uses time travel to go all around the world in a single night. When mercenaries invade the North Pole looking to steal its magical secrets, Bernard goes back in time to stop them ever finding the place. Animated comedy, with the voices of Martin Freeman, Tim Curry, Joan Collins and Tom Baker(n).(n)

programme.title: Strange Magic
programme.desc: A fairy living in an enchanted forest tries to rescue her sister from a monstrous creature. Meanwhile, the magical kingdom is thrown into chaos by a love potion, that results in a series of unexpected romances. Animated fantasy musical, with the voices of Evan Rachel Wood, Alan Cumming and Kristin Chenoweth(n).(n)

programme.title: Beauty and the Beast
programme.desc: A bookish woman agrees to take her father's place as prisoner of a fearsome monster living in a castle deep in the forest. She gradually grows to see a gentler, more human side to her hideous host, and comes to realise she may be able to break the curse that turned him into a beast in the first place. Disney animated fantasy, with the voices of Paige O'Hara and Robby Benson(n).(n)
