programme.title: Angel Flight Down
programme.desc: A mercy mission runs into difficulty when the plane commissioned to airlift a sick girl suffers engine trouble and crashes on the edge of a cliff. Drama, starring Patricia Kalember and David Charvet(n).(n)

programme.title: Breakdown
programme.desc: A stranded motorist is desperate when his wife disappears without a trace on a road trip - and the reluctance of the locals to help convinces him something sinister is going on. When it turns out that she has been abducted by a crazed trucker and his cronies, he is determined to set her free and make sure the villains pay for their crime. Thriller, starring Kurt Russell, Kathleen Quinlan, JT Walsh, MC Gainey, Jack Noseworthy and Rex Linn(n).(n)

programme.title: Careful What You Wish For
programme.desc: A teenager gets more than he bargained for after entering into an affair with the wife of an investment banker, as a suspicious death and substantial life insurance policy embroil him in a scandal. Thriller, starring Nick Jonas, Dermot Mulroney and Isabel Lucas(n).(n)

programme.title: The Boy Next Door
programme.desc: A newly separated teacher embarks on what she believes is a harmless flirtation with the handsome teenager living next door. In a moment of weakness, she succumbs to his advances, and things turn nasty when she tries to end their affair. Thriller, starring Jennifer Lopez, Ryan Guzman and Kristin Chenoweth(n).(n)

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds
programme.desc: A veteran car thief is forced out of retirement to steal 50 top-of-the-range vehicles in exchange for his brother's life. While his sibling is held hostage by a sadistic gangster, he asks his former cronies to help - but with the clock ticking and just a few days remaining to pull off the daunting task, their chances of success are hanging by a thread. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, Angelina Jolie, Giovanni Ribisi and Robert Duvall(n).(n)

programme.title: Revenge of the Green Dragons
programme.desc: Two brothers living in New York's Chinatown in the 1980s rise quickly through the ranks of a local gang. When their organisation clashes with a rival, the siblings are targeted by a hard-bitten cop who is determined to clean up the streets. Crime drama, starring Ray Liotta, Justin Chon and Kevin Wu(n).(n)

programme.title: Escape from Alcatraz
programme.desc: A cunning convict with a history of making escape attempts is transferred to the notorious high-security island prison off the California coast, from which no one has ever broken out. Continually at odds with the brutal warden, he and three fellow prisoners hatch a plan to make it to freedom on an improvised raft. Thriller, based on a true story, starring Clint Eastwood, Patrick McGoohan, Roberts Blossom and Fred Ward(n).(n)

programme.title: In the Line of Fire
programme.desc: An ageing secret service agent, tormented by his failure to save the life of John F Kennedy in 1963, is drawn into a battle of wits with a sinister CIA-trained assassin out to kill the current president. As the day of reckoning draws closer, the agent's nerves are tested to the limit - and nothing seems to be going his way. Wolfgang Petersen's thriller, starring Clint Eastwood, John Malkovich, Rene Russo and Dylan McDermott(n).(n)

programme.title: Swelter
programme.desc: Ten years after their casino heist, four escaped convicts trace their former partner to a desert town, where he is now a lawman with no memory of his criminal past. Drama, starring Jean-Claude Van Damme, Alfred Molina and Lennie James(n).(n)

programme.title: The Boy Next Door
programme.desc: A newly separated teacher embarks on what she believes is a harmless flirtation with the handsome teenager living next door. In a moment of weakness, she succumbs to his advances, and things turn nasty when she tries to end their affair. Thriller, starring Jennifer Lopez, Ryan Guzman and Kristin Chenoweth(n).(n)

programme.title: The Joker
programme.desc: A young cop is kidnapped by a masked serial killer. To keep himself alive, the captive detective must rely on the wisdom imparted to him by his older colleagues during their regular poker night, hoping that one of their tall tales might provide the inspiration he needs to outwit the murderer. Thriller, starring Beau Mirchoff and Ron Perlman(n).(n)

programme.title: Return to Sender
programme.desc: A small-town nurse goes on a blind date with a stranger who rapes her. As she struggles to rebuild her life, she takes to regularly visiting her attacker in prison. However, when he is released, he discovers she has been planning her revenge. Thriller, starring Rosamund Pike, Shiloh Fernandez and Nick Nolte(n).(n)

programme.title: Dying of the Light
programme.desc: A CIA agent is diagnosed with a degenerative condition that results in him being forced to retire from the world of intelligence. When he receives word that a terrorist who once tortured him has resurfaced, he goes rogue and sets out to assassinate the man while he is still able. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, Anton Yelchin and Irene Jacob(n).(n)

programme.title: Point Last Seen
programme.desc: The head of a search and rescue team whose children were kidnapped by her ex-husband hunts obsessively for a girl gone missing in the desert. However, her search is interrupted by news that her spouse has been found - but the children he took are nowhere to be found. Fact-based drama, starring Linda Hamilton and Kevin Kilner(n).(n)

programme.title: Body
programme.desc: Three students break into a house mistakenly thinking it belongs to their friend, and end up accidentally killing the groundskeeper who catches them trespassing. They try to come up with an elaborate lie to cover up their crime, but their consiences begin to trouble them, with deadly consequences. Thriller, starring Helen Rogers, Alexandra Turshen and Lauren Molina(n).(n)

programme.title: The Perfect Guy
programme.desc: A political lobbyist recovering from a painful break-up forms a passionate new relationship with a charming stranger. However, she begins to wonder whether she can trust her new boyfriend has his behaviour grows increasingly volatile - a situation that only gets worse when her ex resurfaces. Thriller, starring Sanaa Lathan and Michael Ealy(n).(n)

programme.title: The Maid's Room
programme.desc: A Colombian immigrant hired as a live-in maid at a luxurious summer house in Long Island witnesses something she shouldn't. Thriller, starring Paula Garces, Annabella Sciorra and Bill Camp(n).(n)

programme.title: Kingsman: The Secret Service
programme.desc: A streetwise teenager is taken under the wing of his dead father's old colleague, an agent working for a super-secret spy organisation. Will the youngster prove to be a chip off the old block by proving useful during a battle against a twisted, hi-tech genius? Action comedy based on a comic book, starring Colin Firth, Taron Egerton and Samuel L Jackson(n).(n)

programme.title: The Loft
programme.desc: Five successful married men rent an apartment where they can carry out their extra-marital affairs in secret. The arrangement works well until they find the corpse of a beautiful woman handcuffed to a bed - but which of them is the killer, and how will the grisly discovery affect their friendship? Thriller, with Karl Urban, James Marsden and Wentworth Miller(n).(n)

programme.title: Every Secret Thing
programme.desc: When a young child goes missing, suspicion falls on two teenagers previously convicted for killing a baby. Thriller, starring Elizabeth Banks, Diane Lane and Dakota Fanning(n).(n)

programme.title: Freezer
programme.desc: Wisecracking ex-con Robert is kidnapped and held hostage in a walk-in freezer by Russian thugs, who are convinced he has $8million from them. As he struggles to fight back against the cold, he soon discovers he is not alone. Thriller, starring Dylan McDermott(n).(n)

programme.title: Southpaw
programme.desc: A boxing champion's successful life is brought to an abrupt end when tragedy strikes. He turns to a trainer coaching amateur fighters in a run-down gym for help and tries to rebuild his sporting career - while also striving to regain the lost trust of his wife and daughter. Drama, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Forest Whitaker and Rachel McAdams(n).(n)

programme.title: Kingsman: The Secret Service
programme.desc: A streetwise teenager is taken under the wing of his dead father's old colleague, an agent working for a super-secret spy organisation. Will the youngster prove to be a chip off the old block by proving useful during a battle against a twisted, hi-tech genius? Action comedy based on a comic book, starring Colin Firth, Taron Egerton and Samuel L Jackson(n).(n)

programme.title: Con Air
programme.desc: A parolee hitches a ride home on a maximum-security flight conveying some of America's deadliest criminals, and when they hijack the plane in mid-flight he is forced to intervene. Meanwhile, a US marshal has an ongoing battle on the ground to prevent the plane from being blown to pieces. Action thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, John Cusack, John Malkovich, Steve Buscemi, Ving Rhames and Colm Meaney(n).(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: Maverick San Francisco detective `Dirty' Harry Callahan sets out to capture a deranged sniper picking off victims at random. Although his own tactics barely stay within the confines of the law, he is determined the killer will face his particular brand of justice, regardless of his superiors' disapproval. Don Siegel's thriller, starring Clint Eastwood, Harry Guardino and Andy Robinson(n).(n)

programme.title: French Connection II
programme.desc: Hard-nosed New York narcotics cop Popeye Doyle pursues a drug dealer to his lair in Marseille. However, he soon lives to regret his decision when he is captured by the criminal and subjected to a cruel revenge by being forcibly addicted to heroin. John Frankenheimer's thriller sequel, starring Gene Hackman, Fernando Rey, Bernard Fresson, Jean-Pierre Castaldi and Charles Millot(n).(n)

programme.title: Sam Churchill: Search for a Homeless Man
programme.desc: A seemingly straightforward missing persons case draws a private investigator into a battle against the members of a child pornography ring, who are holding a teenager he has been hired to find. Thriller, starring John Schneider, Robyn Lively, Alex Rocco and Rudy Ramos(n).(n)

programme.title: American Heist
programme.desc: A man with a shady past is planning to start his own business, but is drawn back into the criminal underworld when his brother is released from prison. The ex-convict has a dangerous plan for an elaborate bank robbery, and family loyalty drives his brother to get involved. Crime drama, starring Adrien Brody, Hayden Christensen and Jordana Brewster(n).(n)

programme.title: Kidnapping Freddy Heineken
programme.desc: Five men struggling to make ends meet decide to kidnap a beer tycoon who is one of Europe's richest men. The plan is a success, and they demand the biggest ransom in history - but tensions within the group threaten their chances of escaping the law. Fact-based crime drama, starring Anthony Hopkins, Jim Sturgess and Sam Worthington(n).(n)

programme.title: The Conversation
programme.desc: An obsessive surveillance expert makes the unprofessional mistake of getting personally involved in a dangerous case. Francis Ford Coppola's thriller, starring Gene Hackman, John Cazale, Robert Duvall, Allen Garfield and Harrison Ford(n).(n)

programme.title: American Ultra
programme.desc: Small-town store clerk and unmotivated stoner Mike is enjoying his life with girlfriend Phoebe when his world is suddenly turned upside down. He is unaware he is actually a highly trained, lethal government sleeper agent who has been targeted for assassination, forcing him to summon his inner action-hero in order to survive. Action comedy, starring Jesse Eisenberg and Kristen Stewart(n).(n)

programme.title: The Rock
programme.desc: A renegade general and his crack team of mercenaries take over the abandoned fortress prison of Alcatraz and threaten San Francisco with toxic nerve-gas rockets to extort a massive ransom. To break their stranglehold on the city, the FBI sends in a chemical weapons expert and a jailed SAS veteran, chosen because he is the only man to have ever escaped from the infamous penitentiary. Action thriller, with Sean Connery, Nicolas Cage and Ed Harris(n).(n)

programme.title: Dark Places
programme.desc: A seven-year-old girl witnesses the murder of her mother and sisters, and testifies that her teenage brother was the killer, leading to his imprisonment. As an adult, she attends a gathering of true-crime fans, and discovers they all think her brother was innocent. She reluctantly agrees to revisit the crime, and begins to realise her memories may not be as reliable as she thought. Mystery, starring Charlize Theron, Nicholas Hoult, Christina Hendricks and Chloe Grace Moretz(n).(n)

programme.title: American Ultra
programme.desc: Small-town store clerk and unmotivated stoner Mike is enjoying his life with girlfriend Phoebe when his world is suddenly turned upside down. He is unaware he is actually a highly trained, lethal government sleeper agent who has been targeted for assassination, forcing him to summon his inner action-hero in order to survive. Action comedy, starring Jesse Eisenberg and Kristen Stewart(n).(n)

programme.title: Zodiac
programme.desc: Fact-based crime thriller about the tortuous hunt for a mysterious serial killer who terrorised San Francisco in the late 1960s and early 1970s, and taunted the police and media with cryptic messages. Three men became obsessed with identifying the murderer after his reign of terror inexplicably stopped, but their fixation with the case took a heavy toll on their lives. Starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Robert Downey Jr, Mark Ruffalo and Brian Cox(n).(n)

programme.title: Son of a Gun
programme.desc: An Australian teen jailed for a minor offence is taken under the protective wing of a veteran criminal. On his release, the youngster is invited to join the older man's gang, which is in the process of planning a major gold heist, but finds his loyalties put to the test. Crime drama, starring Brenton Thwaites, Ewan McGregor and Alicia Vikander(n).(n)

programme.title: Tomorrowland: A World Beyond
programme.desc: A boy genius in the 1960s finds his way into a spectacular futuristic metropolis while attempting to promote his idea for a jetpack. Decades later, he has grown into a disillusioned adult, while a girl who has the talent and enthusiasm he has lost also finds her way into this strange new world, and together they attempt to uncover its secrets. Fantasy adventure, starring George Clooney, Britt Robertson and Hugh Laurie(n).(n)

programme.title: Self/less
programme.desc: A wealthy old man dying of cancer arranges to have his consciousness transplanted into a younger body. The procedure is a success, but he begins to have suspicions about where his new body came from - only to find that the company behind the process will kill to protect their dark secrets. Sci-fi thriller, starring Ryan Reynolds and Ben Kingsley(n).(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: A boy is left disillusioned with Christmas as his dysfunctional family spend the holiday arguing. They must soon learn to work together if they are to see New Year, when a monstrous demon appears, intent on punishing them for their lack of festive spirit - and which has the power to make the house's Christmas decorations take on murderous life. Comedy horror, starring Toni Collette and Emjay Anthony(n).(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: A manned mission to Mars is abruptly abandoned, with one crew member left for dead. However, the astronaut has survived and faces a series of challenges - to contact Earth and arrange his rescue and to survive for the years it will take for a spacecraft to reach him on resources intended to last a month. Ridley Scott's sci-fi drama based on the novel by Andy Weir, starring Matt Damon, Jessica Chastain, Kristen Wiig and Chiwetel Ejiofor(n).(n)

programme.title: Doctor Strange: Special
programme.desc: The making of the new Marvel movie, starring Benedict Cumberbatch as the eponymous hero(n).(n)

programme.title: Paranormal Activity: The Ghost Dimension
programme.desc: A man moves into a new house along with his wife, daughter and younger brother, and finds an old camcorder and a box of videotapes. The siblings start watching the tapes, which turn out to be home movies shot by the property's previous owners, but by doing so, they unleash evil spirits into the world. Horror sequel, starring Chris J Murray and Brit Shaw(n).(n)

Horror sequel, starring Chris J Murray and Brit Shaw(n).(n)

programme.title: Misery
programme.desc: A successful author finds his relief at being rescued from a near-fatal car crash is severely tempered by the discovery that his saviour is a fan with psychopathic tendencies. The situation takes a turn for the worse when she discovers he has killed off her favourite character - and sets about coercing him to do a rewrite in nightmarish fashion. Oscar-winning thriller, starring James Caan, Kathy Bates and Lauren Bacall(n).(n)

programme.title: Dark Signal
programme.desc: A murdered girl's spirit returns with a message for the staff of a radio station. Horror, starring Siwan Morris, Gareth David-Lloyd, Joanna Ignaczewska and Duncan Pow(n).(n)

programme.title: Into the Grizzly Maze
programme.desc: A wild grizzly bear goes on the rampage in a remote Alaskan town. A sheriff ventures into the creature's territory to find his missing wife, enlisting the aid of his ex-convict brother. However, they soon find themselves stalked by the beast, while a famous bear hunter causes further problems. Thriller, starring Thomas Jane, James Marsden, Piper Perabo and Billy Bob Thornton(n).(n)

programme.title: Chappie
programme.desc: Two small-time crooks kidnap the inventor of a highly intelligent law-enforcement robot. They force him to reprogramme the android so it will help them carry out an audacious heist worth $200million, but in doing so, incur the wrath of a ruthless and corrupt general. Sci-fi thriller, starring Sharlto Copley, Hugh Jackman and Dev Patel(n).(n)

programme.title: Doctor Strange: Special
programme.desc: The making of the new Marvel movie, starring Benedict Cumberbatch as the eponymous hero(n).(n)

programme.title: Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: A group of children who escaped from an isolated community at the centre of a mysterious labyrinth find themselves in a desolate wasteland. As they seek the truth about the organisation that imprisoned them, they face a series of terrible dangers. Sci-fi adventure based on the second of James Dashner's series of novels, starring Dylan O'Brien and Kaya Scodelario(n).(n)

programme.title: Ant-Man
programme.desc: A thief attempting to go straight is recruited by a scientist, who provides him with a suit that gives him the power to shrink. He must use his new skills to carry out a special mission - helping the inventor to steal back his miniaturisation technology from a ruthless businessman who intends to turn it into a deadly weapon. Superhero adventure, starring Paul Rudd, Michael Douglas and Evangeline Lilly(n).(n)

programme.title: Scouts Guide To The Zombie Apocalypse
programme.desc: Three boy scouts look forward to spending their last camping trip together. However, they soon have a more pressing need for their wilderness survival skills when their home town is overrun with the walking dead. Fortunately, a tough cocktail waitress is on hand to help the youngsters survive the zombie onslaught. Comedy horror, starring Tye Sheridan, Logan Miller and Joey Morgan(n).(n)

programme.title: Chappie
programme.desc: Two small-time crooks kidnap the inventor of a highly intelligent law-enforcement robot. They force him to reprogramme the android so it will help them carry out an audacious heist worth $200million, but in doing so, incur the wrath of a ruthless and corrupt general. Sci-fi thriller, starring Sharlto Copley, Hugh Jackman and Dev Patel(n).(n)

He must use his new skills to carry out a special mission - helping the inventor to steal back his miniaturisation technology from a ruthless businessman who intends to turn it into a deadly weapon. Superhero adventure, starring Paul Rudd, Michael Douglas and Evangeline Lilly(n).(n)

programme.title: The Returned
programme.desc: A young doctor goes on the run with her bitten boyfriend and their remaining supplies of a protein used to treat a zombie virus. Sci-fi horror, starring Emily Hampshire, Kris Holden-Ried and Shawn Doyle(n).(n)

programme.title: All Hallows' Eve
programme.desc: A teenager looking after two children at Halloween discovers an old video tape in their trick or treat bag. She plays it and discovers it contains recordings of horrific incidents involving a sinister clown - but does not realise that by watching the films she is summoning him into being. Horror anthology, starring Katie Maguire and Mike Giannelli(n).(n)

programme.title: Girlhouse
programme.desc: A beautiful but cash-strapped student raises money for her tuition by having her every move streamed on an adult website. Sadly, the scheme takes a disturbing turn when a deranged stalker breaks into her home before subjecting her to a terrifying ordeal. Horror, starring Ali Cobrin, Adam DiMarco and Slaine(n).(n)

programme.title: Cocoon
programme.desc: The elderly residents of a retirement home treat themselves to an occasional dip in the pool at an abandoned house. It turns out that friendly aliens in human form are using the place to restore dormant members of their species - and energy from their cocoons is giving the old-timers a new lease of life. Ron Howard's sci-fi drama, with Wilford Brimley, Jessica Tandy, Hume Cronyn, Don Ameche and Steve Guttenberg(n).(n)

programme.title: Gattaca
programme.desc: In a future run by a genetically enhanced elite, a caretaker who was born unmodified is barred from all but the most menial jobs. He swaps identities with a former athlete who has lost the use of his legs in an accident, allowing him to realise his dream of joining the space programme. However, a murder investigation threatens to expose his deception. Sci-fi drama, starring Ethan Hawke, Uma Thurman and Jude Law(n).(n)

programme.title: E.T.: The Extra-Terrestrial
programme.desc: A lonely boy befriends an alien who has been left stranded on Earth. The two develop a psychic connection as the boy helps the extraterrestrial to contact his own people and call for rescue. However, living on Earth starts to have a devastating effect on the visitor's health, and a government operative is determined to capture him for study. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi fantasy, starring Henry Thomas, Drew Barrymore, Dee Wallace and Peter Coyote(n).(n)

programme.title: The Visit
programme.desc: Two children are sent by their parents to spend a week at their grandparents' remote farm. They are confused by the old couple's strange house rules, but as they investigate, they discover something disturbing is going on - and that they may not be returning home alive. Horror, starring Olivia DeJonge and Ed Oxenbould(n).(n)

programme.title: Mad Max: Fury Road
programme.desc: A drifter in a post-apocalyptic wasteland encounters a crazed, sadistic warlord and his radiation-afflicted cult. He assists a warrior who has turned against the tyrant, and liberates five women who have been forced to become his brides. Together, they make a desperate journey through the desert to salvation, with their enemies in hot pursuit. Sci-fi thriller sequel, starring Tom Hardy and Charlize Theron(n).(n)

programme.title: Into the Forest
programme.desc: An unexplained cataclysm devastates the world, rendering virtually all technology useless. Two teenage sisters living in the backwoods face a series of challenges as they struggle to survive in a world changed beyond all recognition. Sci-fi drama based on Jean Hegland's novel, starring Ellen Page and Evan Rachel Wood(n).(n)

programme.title: Gattaca
programme.desc: In a future run by a genetically enhanced elite, a caretaker who was born unmodified is barred from all but the most menial jobs. He swaps identities with a former athlete who has lost the use of his legs in an accident, allowing him to realise his dream of joining the space programme. However, a murder investigation threatens to expose his deception. Sci-fi drama, starring Ethan Hawke, Uma Thurman and Jude Law(n).(n)

Horror, starring Olivia DeJonge and Ed Oxenbould(n).(n)

programme.title: Mad Max: Fury Road
programme.desc: A drifter in a post-apocalyptic wasteland encounters a crazed, sadistic warlord and his radiation-afflicted cult. He assists a warrior who has turned against the tyrant, and liberates five women who have been forced to become his brides. Together, they make a desperate journey through the desert to salvation, with their enemies in hot pursuit. Sci-fi thriller sequel, starring Tom Hardy and Charlize Theron(n).(n)

programme.title: Into the Forest
programme.desc: An unexplained cataclysm devastates the world, rendering virtually all technology useless. Two teenage sisters living in the backwoods face a series of challenges as they struggle to survive in a world changed beyond all recognition. Sci-fi drama based on Jean Hegland's novel, starring Ellen Page and Evan Rachel Wood(n).(n)

programme.title: Appaloosa
programme.desc: Straight-shooting peacemakers Everett and Virgil try to restore order in a town under the control of crooked rancher Randall and his murderous gang. However, the pair find their friendship threatened by the arrival of attractive widow Allison, who leads Virgil to question his nomadic existence. Western, starring Ed Harris, Viggo Mortensen, Jeremy Irons and Renee Zellweger(n).(n)

programme.title: Sixteen
programme.desc: An African former child soldier now living in London tries to leave his violent past behind him as he approaches his 16th birthday, but when he witnesses a stabbing and the people involved want to make sure that he says nothing to the police, violence forces its way back into his life. Thriller, starring Roger Jean Nsengiyumva, Rachael Stirling and Rosie Day(n).(n)

programme.title: The Forgotten Kingdom
programme.desc: A young man reluctantly embarks on a journey to his ancestral land of Lesotho to bury his estranged father, and finds himself drawn to the mystical beauty and hardships of the people and the land he had forgotten. Drama, starring Zenzo Ngqobe, Nozipho Nkelemba and Lebohang Ntsane. In Southern Sotho(n).(n)

programme.title: The Commitments
programme.desc: A would-be music producer from Dublin believes he can make it big in Ireland by promoting a top-rate soul band, so he trawls a working-class neighbourhood and auditions unlikely singers and musicians to put together as a group. Alan Parker's urban comedy, based on the novel by Roddy Doyle, starring Robert Arkins, Andrew Strong, Michael Aherne, Angeline Ball and Maria Doyle Kennedy(n).(n)

programme.title: For a Few Dollars More
programme.desc: An enigmatic gunslinger forms an uneasy alliance with a military veteran to track down a notorious outlaw - but tensions simmer as their very different motives for the hunt put them increasingly at odds. Sergio Leone's Western sequel, starring Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef, Gian Maria Volonte, Josef Egger, Mara Krup and Klaus Kinski(n).(n)

programme.title: Rain Man
programme.desc: Brash yuppie car dealer Charlie discovers his deceased father has left the family fortune to Raymond, the autistic elder brother he never knew he had. In a bid to get his hands on the money, he tracks down and abducts Raymond - but the ensuing cross-country journey proves to be a profound learning experience. Oscar-winning drama, starring Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman, with Valeria Golino, Gerald R Molen and Jack Murdock(n).(n)

programme.title: Ex Machina
programme.desc: A computer programmer working for the world's biggest search engine is given the opportunity to spend a week at the remote home of his boss, a hi-tech genius. The break turns out to be an elaborate experiment, in which he must test the world's first truly artificial intelligence, which is housed in the body of a beautiful robot girl. Sci-fi drama, starring Domhnall Gleeson, Alicia Vikander and Oscar Isaac(n).(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: A woman joins a campaign to gain the right to vote in 1912. She and her allies find their peaceful protests accomplishing little in the face of an unwavering state, so resort to increasingly violent measures, risking everything they have in the pursuit of political justice. Period drama, starring Carey Mulligan, Helena Bonham Carter, Anne-Marie Duff and Meryl Streep(n).(n)

programme.title: Out of Sight
programme.desc: A charming bank robber breaks out of jail and takes a female US Marshal hostage. Managing to escape, she sets out to track him down as he prepares for one last job - but as the chase intensifies, so do their feelings for each other. Steven Soderbergh's romantic crime drama, based on Elmore Leonard's novel, with George Clooney, Jennifer Lopez, Ving Rhames and Don Cheadle(n).(n)

programme.title: Election
programme.desc: A teacher develops an irrational dislike for an overambitious student and plans to sabotage her campaign for school president. He persuades a dim-witted athlete to stand, in the hope he will pip the high-achieving front-runner to the post - but the intervention of another student throws the plan into disarray. Satirical comedy, starring Matthew Broderick, Reese Witherspoon, Chris Klein and Jessica Campbell(n).(n)

programme.title: Tokyo Tribe
programme.desc: In an alternative, dystopian Tokyo, rival street gangs must join forces to defeat their common enemy, a cannibalistic gangster. Japanese sci-fi drama based on a popular Manga series, starring Ryohei Suzuki, Riki Takeuchi and Akihiro Kitamura(n).(n)

programme.title: The Overnight
programme.desc: A couple and their young son move to another city, and find themselves feeling adrift in a strange place. Things seem to change for the better when they meet another family and spend the evening at their new friends' house - but things quickly take a disturbing turn once the kids are in bed. Black comedy, starring Adam Scott, Taylor Schilling and Jason Schwartzman(n).(n)

programme.title: Dangerous Liaisons
programme.desc: A philandering aristocrat in 18th-century France schemes with his manipulative former lover to seduce a virtuous young woman. As their conspiracy becomes ever more tangled, events take an unexpected turn. Stephen Frears' Oscar-winning drama of sexual politics, based on Pierre Choderlos de Laclos' novel, starring John Malkovich, Glenn Close, Michelle Pfeiffer, Swoosie Kurtz, Uma Thurman and Keanu Reeves(n).(n)

programme.title: The New World
programme.desc: A 17th-century English settler in America falls in love with a native princess, but as conflict erupts between their people he is forced to abandon her. She is converted to Christianity, adopting European culture and forming a romance with a tobacco planter, but remains torn between two worlds. Terrence Malick's epic historical drama, starring Colin Farrell, Q'orianka Kilcher, Christian Bale and Christopher Plummer(n).(n)

programme.title: Deep in the Wood
programme.desc: When a missing boy reappears after five years his father welcomes him back with open arms, but his mother has her suspicions. Mystery thriller, starring Filippo Nigro, Camilla Filippi and Giovanni Vettorazzo(n).(n)

programme.title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
programme.desc: A laconic gunslinger, a ruthless hired killer and a conniving outlaw hunt for a cache of loot during the chaos of the American Civil War. However, each is privy to only part of the information necessary to find it, setting in motion a series of deadly betrayals. The third film in Sergio Leone's Spaghetti Western trilogy, starring Clint Eastwood as the Man with No Name, with Lee Van Cleef and Eli Wallach. With a soundtrack by Ennio Morricone(n).(n)

programme.title: Bluebird
programme.desc: During a freezing cold winter in the frozen woods of an isolated Maine logging town, a lapse of concentration has devastating consequences for a school bus driver. Drama, starring Amy Morton, John Slattery and Louisa Krause(n).(n)

programme.title: The Walk
programme.desc: A French acrobat hatches an audacious scheme to carry out his most spectacular performance in 1974. With the aid of his circus mentor and an international team of helpers, he plans to tightrope walk between the towers of the World Trade Centre. Fact-based drama, starring Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Ben Kingsley(n).(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Artist Gerda Wegener unveils a portrait of her husband Einar dressed as a woman in 1920s Copenhagen. Einar realises that the woman in the painting is his true identity, and decides to become one of the first people to undergo sex reassignment surgery. Period drama based on David Ebershoff's novel inspired by the true story of artist Lili Elbe, starring Eddie Redmayne and an Oscar-winning Alicia Vikander(n).(n)

programme.title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
programme.desc: A laconic gunslinger, a ruthless hired killer and a conniving outlaw hunt for a cache of loot during the chaos of the American Civil War. However, each is privy to only part of the information necessary to find it, setting in motion a series of deadly betrayals. The third film in Sergio Leone's Spaghetti Western trilogy, starring Clint Eastwood as the Man with No Name, with Lee Van Cleef and Eli Wallach. With a soundtrack by Ennio Morricone(n).(n)

programme.title: The Survivalist
programme.desc: A loner survives the downfall of civilisation, living in a remote cabin on a small plot of land. When two women discover his refuge, he grudgingly allows them food and shelter, but they struggle to trust one another, especially as the supplies begin to run out. Thriller, starring Martin McCann and Mia Goth(n).(n)

programme.title: The Outlaw Josey Wales
programme.desc: A Confederate soldier refuses to surrender at the end of the Civil War, and is branded a dangerous outlaw. Crossing America in search of sanctuary from the army and bounty hunters, he only wants solitude - but ends up with a strange assortment of travelling companions. Western, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood. With Chief Dan George and Sondra Locke(n).(n)

programme.title: The Walk
programme.desc: A French acrobat hatches an audacious scheme to carry out his most spectacular performance in 1974. With the aid of his circus mentor and an international team of helpers, he plans to tightrope walk between the towers of the World Trade Centre. Fact-based drama, starring Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Ben Kingsley(n).(n)

programme.title: Dead Calm
programme.desc: A husband and wife take a yachting trip to help recover from the death of their son. While out on the open water the couple spot a sinking ship and manage to save the only person left on board - but they come to bitterly regret their good deed when the situation turns dark and a fraught battle of wits ensues. Thriller, based on a novel by Charles Williams, with Sam Neill, Nicole Kidman and Billy Zane(n).(n)

programme.title: Cub
programme.desc: A young boy goes on a camping trip with his fellow Cub Scouts, and crosses paths with a bloodthirsty poacher. Belgian horror, starring Maurice Luijten, Evelien Bosmans and Titus De Voogdt. In Flemish, French and Dutch(n).(n)

programme.title: Living Is Easy with Eyes Closed
programme.desc: An English teacher in Spain picks up two hitchhikers on his quest to meet John Lennon. Comedy drama set in 1966, starring Javier Camara, Natalia de Molina and Francesc Colomer(n).(n)

programme.title: Frost/Nixon
programme.desc: British broadcaster and journalist David Frost comes up with the idea of setting up a series of exclusive televised interviews with the disgraced former president of the United States, Richard Nixon. Believing he could use the publicity as a chance to resurrect his political career and make some easy money, Nixon agrees but soon realises he has underestimated Frost. Fact-based drama, starring Frank Langella, Michael Sheen, Sam Rockwell and Kevin Bacon(n).(n)

programme.title: All the President's Men
programme.desc: The true story of Washington Post reporters Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein, who persevered in their investigation of the links between the Watergate break-in and the White House, a scandal that eventually forced the resignation of President Nixon. Alan J Pakula's drama, starring Robert Redford, Dustin Hoffman, Jason Robards and Hal Holbrook(n).(n)

programme.title: Juno
programme.desc: A teenage girl finds herself pregnant after a one-night stand with her best friend. Deciding to give her baby up for adoption, she thinks she has found the perfect parents in a yuppie couple. However, over the next nine months she begins to experience doubts about her plans. Comedy, starring Ellen Page, Michael Cera, Jennifer Garner and Jason Bateman(n).(n)

programme.title: Whiplash
programme.desc: A talented young jazz drummer thinks all his dreams have come true when he lands a place at a prestigious music academy. However, the experience turns into a nightmare thanks to an uncompromising tutor who will stop at nothing to make his students realise their potential - including physical and mental abuse. Drama, starring Miles Teller, JK Simmons and Paul Reiser(n).(n)

programme.title: Joy
programme.desc: An imaginative youngster with dreams of being an inventor grows up to be a downtrodden single mother, struggling to support her chaotic family. She sees a chance to turn all their lives around when inspiration strikes and she creates a new household tool, but faces the challenge of selling her product in the demanding world of a home shopping TV station. Fact-based drama, starring Jennifer Lawrence, Robert De Niro and Bradley Cooper(n).(n)

programme.title: Grosse Pointe Blank
programme.desc: A hitman takes the chance to combine his latest assassination job with a trip back to his home town for a school reunion. The occasion starts to get complicated when an old flame turns up and rekindles their lost romance - while a rival killer harasses him to join an assassins' union. Black comedy drama, starring John Cusack, Minnie Driver, Dan Aykroyd, Joan Cusack and Alan Arkin(n).(n)

programme.title: Hanover Street
programme.desc: An American bomber pilot falls in love with a married nurse in London during the Second World War, and later finds himself assigned with her husband on the same dangerous mission, leading to much soul-searching. Drama, starring Harrison Ford, Lesley-Anne Down, Christopher Plummer, Alec McCowen and Patsy Kensit(n).(n)

programme.title: Terror in a Texas Town
programme.desc: An embittered Scandinavian seaman sets out to avenge the murder of his farmer father, who was killed after refusing to bow to the demands of a ruthless land baron. Western, starring Sterling Hayden, Sebastian Cabot, Carol Kelly and Eugene Martin(n).(n)

programme.title: Thunder Bay
programme.desc: A former Navy engineer comes up with a plan to establish an offshore oil drilling site on the Louisiana coast. However, his scheme is threatened by dangerous weather conditions, his own treacherous financial backers, and irate locals who fear for their fishing business. Action adventure, with James Stewart and Joanne Dru(n).(n)

programme.title: Carry On Teacher
programme.desc: A headmaster hopes to land a more prestigious job at a better school, but his pupils do not want him to leave. When two inspectors pay a visit, the mischievous students see a chance to sabotage his career plans with a series of pranks. Comedy, starring Ted Ray, Kenneth Connor, Charles Hawtrey and Kenneth Williams(n).(n)

programme.title: The Tourist
programme.desc: A fugitive's girlfriend is being watched by the police while travelling from Paris to Venice. She seduces an unsuspecting American tourist to make them think he is her lover with his appearance altered by plastic surgery, leaving the baffled holidaymaker pursued across Europe by the cops and rival gangsters. Romantic thriller, with Johnny Depp, Angelina Jolie and Paul Bettany(n).(n)

programme.title: 47 Ronin
programme.desc: A band of samurai is betrayed by a ruthless warlord who murders the warriors' master and banishes them from their homeland. They receive fresh hope in the shape of a mysterious former slave, who leads them into battle against monstrous and magical enemies as they seek to reclaim their former status. Fantasy adventure, starring Keanu Reeves and Hiroyuki Sanada(n).(n)

programme.title: American Reunion
programme.desc: Jim Levenstein and his old friends return to their home town for a high-school reunion. Struck by how much their lives have changed, they set out to relive the sexual misadventures of their adolescence, but only end up making bigger fools of themselves than they did as teenagers. Comedy sequel to the American Pie movies, starring Jason Biggs and Alyson Hannigan(n).(n)

programme.title: Hyde Park on Hudson
programme.desc: President Franklin Roosevelt prepares to welcome the king and queen of Britain to his New York country estate in 1939. While the visiting royals hope to persuade the US to side with them in the coming Second World War, their host is more concerned with pursuing a secret affair with a distant cousin. Drama, starring Bill Murray, Laura Linney, Samuel West and Olivia Colman(n).(n)

programme.title: The Yellow Mountain
programme.desc: Two gold prospectors stumble across a rich vein in a neighbour's disused mine, but the prospect of untold riches leads to tension and a violent conflict with a deadly rival. Western, starring Howard Duff, Lex Barker, Mala Powers, William Demarest and John McIntire(n).(n)

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: A former Confederate soldier takes a job building the Santa Fe railroad after the end of the Civil War and tries to persuade his three brothers to join him, fearing they will otherwise fall into a life of crime owing to their enduring hatred of the North. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Jerome Courtland, Janis Carter and Peter Thompson(n).(n)

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: A naval officer is given the command of an old sailing ship to undertake a very important mission - to transport an Australian agent into enemy waters so he can spy on the Japanese. However, he finds the ship is falling apart at the seams and is manned by a crew that does not know how to sail her. Second World War comedy, with Jack Lemmon, Ricky Nelson, John Lund, Chips Rafferty and Tom Tully(n).(n)

programme.title: Prince Valiant
programme.desc: A Christian Viking prince is invited to King Arthur's court, where he discovers the most trusted man at Camelot is hatching a fiendish plot to bring about the demise of the king and the Knights of the Round Table. Adventure, based on the newspaper comic-strip by Hal Foster, starring Robert Wagner, Janet Leigh, James Mason, Debra Paget and Sterling Hayden(n).(n)

programme.title: We Bought a Zoo
programme.desc: A father-of-two struggling to cope with the death of his wife is in need of a fresh start, so buys a house with a dilapidated zoo on the grounds. With the help of the keepers, he works to restore the attraction to its former glory, while also trying to reconnect with his troubled teenage son. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Matt Damon, Scarlett Johansson and Thomas Haden Church(n).(n)

programme.title: Taken 2
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Bryan Mills and his ex-wife Lenore are taken hostage in Istanbul by an Albanian gangster, whose son Bryan was killed while bringing down a kidnapping ring. He is able to escape with the aid of his daughter, and together they fight to rescue Lenore and wipe out the criminal family. Action thriller sequel, starring Liam Neeson, Maggie Grace and Famke Janssen(n).(n)

programme.title: Blue Ruin
programme.desc: Premiere. Homeless drifter Dwight hears that the man who murdered his parents has been released from jail and decides to track down and kill him, but ends up being hunted himself by the killer's family. Thriller, starring Macon Blair, Devin Ratray and Eve Plumb(n).(n)

programme.title: The Last Temptation of Christ
programme.desc: A self-doubting Jesus dreams of the life he could have if he were to escape his destiny and live as an ordinary man. Martin Scorsese's Biblical drama based on Nikos Kazantzakis' novel, starring Willem Dafoe, Harvey Keitel, Barbara Hershey and David Bowie(n).(n)

programme.title: The 300 Spartans
programme.desc: The ruler of the Persian empire vows to expand his realm by conquering Greece. The king of Sparta steps forward to defend his homeland and the other kingdoms of Greece, but when he is betrayed by a political council, he finds himself without an army and must fend off the vast invading army with a mere 300 warriors. Historical drama, starring Richard Egan, Ralph Richardson and Diane Baker(n).(n)

programme.title: Stagecoach
programme.desc: A group of strangers, including a drunken doctor, a pregnant army officer's wife and an embezzling bank clerk, embarks on a dangerous journey across hostile territory. They are joined by an outlaw, falsely accused of murder, who helps them when a Sioux war party attacks. Remake of John Ford's Western, with Bing Crosby and Ann-Margret(n).(n)

programme.title: The Train
programme.desc: As the Allies look set to liberate Paris from the Nazi forces, the Germans resolve to take all they can from the city - and plot to transport national treasures back to Berlin. However, bold French Resistance forces vow to stop them, enlisting the help of a train inspector along the way. Second World War adventure, starring Burt Lancaster, Paul Scofield, Jeanne Moreau and Michel Simon(n).(n)

programme.title: Clear and Present Danger
programme.desc: A CIA analyst gets caught up in the Colombian drug trade while trying to track down terrorists responsible for the murder of a close friend of the US president - but his investigations point to illegal activity and corruption at the very top of government. Action thriller, based on Tom Clancy's novel, with Harrison Ford reprising his role from Patriot Games alongside Willem Dafoe, Anne Archer and James Earl Jones(n).(n)

programme.title: The Rewrite
programme.desc: Premiere. A washed-up Hollywood screenwriter takes a job at a small university, planning to exploit his position as a local celebrity and do as little work as possible. His cynical outlook begins to change when he falls for a single mother working toward her degree, while a talented pupil makes him consider what he wants from his life. Romantic comedy, with Hugh Grant, Marisa Tomei, Allison Janney and JK Simmons(n).(n)

programme.title: Lovelace
programme.desc: Biopic of 1970s adult film star Linda Lovelace, contrasting her glamorous reputation following the release of groundbreaking adult movie Deep Throat - which made her an international star - to the dark account of exploitation and abuse she revealed to the world years later. Starring Amanda Seyfried, Peter Sarsgaard, Sharon Stone and Robert Patrick(n).(n)

programme.title: One Christmas
programme.desc: A boy is sent to spend Christmas with the alcoholic father he has never met and finds that the festive season helps bring them together. Drama, starring Katharine Hepburn and Henry Winkler(n).(n)

programme.title: Miracle of the Heart
programme.desc: After losing a patient in surgery, doctor Nathan Andrews takes a break from his career and returns to his small town roots. A chance encounter with an old acquaintance offers him a promise for the future, only for a tragedy to call into question everything he believes. Drama, starring Neil Patrick Harris, Rebecca Gayheart and Rob Lowe(n).(n)

programme.title: Santa Jr
programme.desc: Father Christmas's ne'er-do-well son decides to prove he can follow in his father's footsteps and goes out delivering presents. However, his good deed coincides with a spate of burglaries, and he ends up being arrested for the crimes. Comedy, starring Nick Stabile, Judd Nelson, Lauren Holly and George Wallace(n).(n)

programme.title: Christmas Every Day
programme.desc: Glum teenager Billy Jackson refuses to get into the yuletide spirit, and lashes out at his exuberant younger sister, Sarah, telling her there is no Father Christmas. In response, young Sarah wishes it could be Christmas every day, and when her request comes true, sullen Billy is forced to relive the holiday over and over again until he is able to appreciate its significance. Festive fantasy, starring Erik von Detten, Bess Armstrong, Yvonne Zima and Robert Hays(n).(n)

programme.title: A Christmas Snow
programme.desc: A woman refuses to celebrate Christmas, because of her father abandoning his family during the holiday. programme.title: The Duff

programme.title: Cold Souls

programme.title: The Spymasters - CIA in the Crosshairs
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the inner workings of the world's most powerful intelligence organization, with unprecedented access to America's spy network, all 12 living CIA directors and top agency operatives, who talk candidly about torture, secret prisons, drone warfare, alleged assassinations and the constant threat of attack, which begs the question: how far should America go to keep us safe? Narrated by Mandy Patinkin ('Homeland')(n).(n)

programme.title: Summer of Sam

programme.title: Lenny Cooke

But over a decade later, while his peers are taking home MVP awards and championship trophies, Lenny has never played a minute in the NBA. What went wrong? A quintessentially American story about dreaming big, the fickle nature of sports celebrity and the unfulfilled destiny of a man for whom superstardom was only just out of reach(n).(n)

programme.title: Bing

programme.title: My Story

programme.title: Mister Maker Around the World

programme.title: Nina and the Neurons: Brilliant Bodies

programme.title: Magic Hands
programme.desc: A Midsummer Night's Dream by William Shakespeare. Look at what my hands can do! To celebrate the 400-year legacy of Shakespeare, Aimee and Ashley head off to an enchanted forest to discover why Bobbles and Pink Bird, dressing up as King and Queen of the Fairies, have fallen out so badly. Here they meet some squabbling fairies, a playful elf and Leapy Lion dressed as a man with a donkey's head!(n).(n)

programme.title: What's the Big Idea

programme.title: Andy's Baby Animals
programme.desc: Swimming lessons for young animals with Andy Day. In New Zealand baby fur seals choose a safe pool in a river. In Antarctica Adelie penguin chicks have to learn how to sink. Polar bears live on the ice, but they're great in the Arctic water too(n).(n)

programme.title: Our Family
programme.sub-title: Sunday at Raphael and Eli's House.
programme.desc: Today we visit brothers, five-year old Raphael and three-year old Eli, in this pre-school observational documentary series.
